Signature  
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Virat_Kohli_Signature.svg/250px-Virat_Kohli_Signature.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_Signature.svg>)  
**Virat Kohli** (born 5 November 1988)[[b]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-6>) is an Indian [international cricketer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cricket> "Cricket") who plays [Test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Test_cricket> "Test cricket") and [ODI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/One_Day_International> "One Day International") cricket for the [national team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/India_national_cricket_team> "India national cricket team") and is a former [captain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Captain_\(cricket\)> "Captain \(cricket\)") in all formats.[[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-7>) He is a right-handed [batsman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Batting_\(cricket\)> "Batting \(cricket\)") and an occasional right arm medium [pace bowler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Bowling_\(cricket\)> "Bowling \(cricket\)"). He is called the king, the chase master and the run machine for his playing style, records and ability to lead the team to victory.[[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-8>) Kohli is the highest run-scorer in the [Indian Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_Indian_Premier_League_records_and_statistics#Individual_batting_records> "List of Indian Premier League records and statistics"), third in [T20I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_Twenty20_International_records#Batting_records> "List of Twenty20 International records"), third in [ODI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_One_Day_International_cricket_records#Individual_records_\(batting\)> "List of One Day International cricket records"), and third in international cricket.[[7]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-9>) Regarded as one of the greatest batsmen of all time, he holds the [record for the most ODI centuries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_One_Day_International_cricket_records#Most_centuries> "List of One Day International cricket records") and has the [second most centuries in international cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_cricketers_by_number_of_international_centuries_scored#Men's_international_cricket> "List of cricketers by number of international centuries scored").[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-10>) Kohli is also the only captain to lead India to three consecutive [Test mace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Test_Championship_Mace> "ICC Test Championship Mace") wins during 2017, 2018, and 2019.[[9]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-11>)
Kohli led the Indian team to victory at the [2008 U19 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup") and was a key member of the teams that won the [2011 ODI World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Cricket_World_Cup> "2011 Cricket World Cup"), [2013 Champions Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2013_ICC_Champions_Trophy> "2013 ICC Champions Trophy"), [2024 T20 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2024_T20_World_Cup> "2024 T20 World Cup") and [2025 Champions Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_ICC_Champions_Trophy> "2025 ICC Champions Trophy"). He represents [Royal Challengers Bengaluru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bengaluru> "Royal Challengers Bengaluru") in the [Indian Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_Premier_League> "Indian Premier League") and [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Delhi_cricket_team> "Delhi cricket team") in [domestic cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cricket_in_India> "Cricket in India"). In 2013, Kohli was ranked number one in the ODI batting [rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Men%27s_Player_Rankings> "ICC Men's Player Rankings"). In 2015, he achieved the same in T20I.[[10]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-12>) In 2018, he was ranked the number one Test batsman, making him the only Indian to hold the number one spot in all three formats. He is the first player to score 20,000 runs in a decade. [ICC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/International_Cricket_Council> "International Cricket Council") named him the [male cricketer of the decade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Awards_of_the_Decade> "ICC Awards of the Decade") for the years [2011 to 2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011-2020_ICC_Awards_of_the_Decade> "2011-2020 ICC Awards of the Decade").[[11]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-13>)
Kohli has garnered 10 [ICC Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Awards> "ICC Awards") making him the most awarded player in international cricket history. He won the [ODI Player of the Year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_ODI_Player_of_the_Year> "ICC ODI Player of the Year") award four times in 2012, 2017, 2018, and 2023. He has also won the [Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sir_Garfield_Sobers_Trophy> "Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy") given to the Cricketer of the Year, on two occasions, in 2017 and 2018. In 2018, he touched his peak and became the first player to win all the three major awards [Garfield Sobers trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Garfield_Sobers_Trophy> "Garfield Sobers Trophy"), ODI and [Test Player of the Year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Test_Player_of_the_Year> "ICC Test Player of the Year") awards in the same year. He was awarded with [Spirit of Cricket Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Awards> "ICC Awards") in 2019. He was also awarded with [Cricketer of the Decade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Awards_of_the_Decade> "ICC Awards of the Decade") and [ODI Cricketer of the Decade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Awards_of_the_Decade> "ICC Awards of the Decade") in 2020. Kohli was named the [_Wisden_ Leading Cricketer in the World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wisden_Leading_Cricketer_in_the_World> "Wisden Leading Cricketer in the World") for three consecutive years, from 2016 to 2018. Kohli has the most Player of the Series awards and second most [Player of the Match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Player_of_the_Match_awards_\(cricket\)> "Player of the Match awards \(cricket\)") awards to his name in all three formats combined. He was honoured with the [Arjuna Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Arjuna_Award> "Arjuna Award") in 2013, the [Padma Shri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Padma_Shri> "Padma Shri") in 2017, and India's highest sporting honour, the [Khel Ratna Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Khel_Ratna_Award> "Khel Ratna Award"), in 2018. _[Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Time_\(magazine\)> "Time \(magazine\)")_ magazine included him on its list of the [100 most influential people in the world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Time_100> "Time 100") in 2018. 
After winning the [2024 T20 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2024_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup> "2024 Men's T20 World Cup") and winning the Player of the Match award in the [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2024_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup_final> "2024 Men's T20 World Cup final"), Kohli announced his retirement from T20Is.[[12]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-14>) He is married to actress [Anushka Sharma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Anushka_Sharma> "Anushka Sharma") and they have two children.[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-15>)
## Early life
Kohli was born on 5 November 1988 in [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Delhi> "Delhi") into a [Punjabi Hindu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Punjabi_Hindu> "Punjabi Hindu") family. His mother Saroj Kohli is as a housewife while his father Prem Nath Kohli worked as a criminal lawyer. He has an elder brother Vikas and an elder sister Bhawna.[[14]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Pratap_Sahi-2011-16>) His formative years were spent in [Uttam Nagar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Uttam_Nagar> "Uttam Nagar"). His early education was at Vishal Bharti Public School.[[15]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Das-2012-17>) As per his family, Kohli exhibited an early affinity for cricket as a 3-year-old. He would pick up a [bat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cricket_bat> "Cricket bat") and request his father bowl to him.[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-thisis2-18>)
In 1998, the [West Delhi Cricket Academy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/West_Delhi_Cricket_Academy> "West Delhi Cricket Academy") was created. In May, his father arranged for him to meet [Rajkumar Sharma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rajkumar_Sharma_\(cricketer\)> "Rajkumar Sharma \(cricketer\)").[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) Upon the suggestion of their neighbours, Kohli's father considered enrolling his son in a professional cricket academy, as they believed his ability merited more than [gully cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gully_cricket> "Gully cricket").[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-ToI2008-19>) He was unable to secure a place in the U-14 Delhi team, due to extraneous factors. His father reportedly received offers to relocate his son to influential clubs, which would ensure his selection, but he declined the proposals. 
Kohli found his way into the U-15 team.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) He received training at the academy and participated in matches at the [Sumeet Dogra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sumeet_Dogra> "Sumeet Dogra") Academy located at [Vasundhara Enclave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Vasundhara_Enclave> "Vasundhara Enclave").[[18]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-symbol2-20>) In pursuit of furthering his cricketing career, he transferred to Saviour Convent School during his ninth-grade education.[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-ToI2008-19>)
On 18 December 2006, his father died due to a [cerebral attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Stroke> "Stroke").[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-ToI2008-19>)[[15]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Das-2012-17>) As per his mother, Kohli's demeanour shifted noticeably after his father's death. He took on cricket with newfound seriousness, prioritizing playing time and dedicating himself fully to the sport.[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-ToI2008-19>) Kohli's family resided in [Meera Bagh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Meera_Bagh> "Meera Bagh"), [Paschim Vihar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Paschim_Vihar> "Paschim Vihar") until the year 2015, after which they relocated to [Gurgaon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gurgaon> "Gurgaon").[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-21>)
## Youth career

---  
**[U19 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Under-19_Men%27s_Cricket_World_Cup> "Under-19 Men's Cricket World Cup")**  
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Simple_gold_cup.svg/20px-Simple_gold_cup.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Simple_gold_cup.svg>) [2008 Malaysia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup") | Captain  | Player of the MatchVs [West Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/West_Indies_under-19_cricket_team> "West Indies under-19 cricket team")Vs [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/New_Zealand_national_under-19_cricket_team> "New Zealand national under-19 cricket team")  
### Delhi team
Kohli's junior cricket career kicked off in October 2002 at the [Luhnu Cricket Ground](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Luhnu_Cricket_Ground> "Luhnu Cricket Ground") against [Himachal Pradesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Himachal_Pradesh_cricket_team> "Himachal Pradesh cricket team"). His first [half-century](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Half_century> "Half century") in domestic cricket happened at [Feroze Shah Kotla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Feroze_Shah_Kotla_Stadium> "Feroze Shah Kotla Stadium"), where he scored 70 [runs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Run_\(cricket\)> "Run \(cricket\)") against [Haryana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Haryana_cricket_team> "Haryana cricket team").[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) By the end of the season, he had amassed a total of 172 runs, emerging as the highest run-scorer for his side with an [average](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Batting_average_\(cricket\)> "Batting average \(cricket\)") of 34.40.[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:35-22>) During the 2003–04 season, Kohli was appointed the [captain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Captain_\(cricket\)> "Captain \(cricket\)") of the U-15 team. He scored 54 runs in [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Delhi_cricket_team> "Delhi cricket team")'s victory over Himachal Pradesh. In the next fixture against [Jammu and Kashmir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jammu_and_Kashmir_cricket_team> "Jammu and Kashmir cricket team"), Kohli scored his maiden [century](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Century_\(cricket\)> "Century \(cricket\)") with a score of 119. By the end of the season, he had a total of 390 runs at an average of 78, which included two centuries.[[21]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-23>)[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) Towards the end of 2004, Kohli earned selection for the 2004–05 [Vijay Merchant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Vijay_Merchant> "Vijay Merchant") Trophy with the Delhi U-17 team. In the four matches that he played, Kohli had a total of 470 runs, with his highest score being 251[*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Not_out> "Not out") runs. 
The team's coach, Ajit Chaudhary, lauded his performance and was particularly impressed with his temperament on the field.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>)[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-24>) He commenced the 2005–06 season with a score of 227 against [Punjab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Punjab_cricket_team_\(India\)> "Punjab cricket team \(India\)"). Following their victory over [Uttar Pradesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Uttar_Pradesh_cricket_team> "Uttar Pradesh cricket team") in the quarter-finals, Delhi was scheduled to play against [Baroda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Baroda_cricket_team> "Baroda cricket team") in the semi-finals. The team had high expectations from Kohli, who had promised his coach to finish the job. True to his word, Kohli went on to score 228 runs, leading Delhi to victory. The team later secured the tournament with a five-wicket win over [Mumbai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mumbai_cricket_team> "Mumbai cricket team"), where he contributed with a half-century in the first [innings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Innings> "Innings").[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) He ended as the highest run-scorer with a total of 757 runs from 7 matches, averaging 84.11.[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-25>)
On 18 February 2006, Kohli made his debut in [List A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_A> "List A") cricket, playing against [Services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Services_cricket_team> "Services cricket team") in the [Ranji One-Day Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ranji_One-day_Trophy> "Ranji One-day Trophy"), but he did not get the opportunity to bat during the match.[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-26>) In 2006, Kohli got a spot in the state senior team. Subsequently, he made his [first-class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/First-class_cricket> "First-class cricket") debut on 23 November 2006, during the opening match of the [Ranji Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ranji_Trophy> "Ranji Trophy") season against [Tamil Nadu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tamil_Nadu_cricket_team> "Tamil Nadu cricket team"). However, his debut innings was a brief one, as he was dismissed after scoring ten runs.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) In the subsequent match against former champions, [Karnataka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Karnataka_cricket_team> "Karnataka cricket team"), Delhi found themselves trailing with a score of 130/5, with Kohli remaining unbeaten on 40 at the end of the day's play. That night, Kohli's father passed away. Despite the heart-wrenching news, Kohli returned to the match and continued to bat and scored 90 runs before he was dismissed.[[25]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-27>) [Chetan Chauhan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Chetan_Chauhan> "Chetan Chauhan"), the coach, was impressed by his determination and unwavering attitude in the face of adversity. [Venkatesh Prasad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Venkatesh_Prasad> "Venkatesh Prasad") lauded his crucial knock, which was executed in the midst of an emotional upheaval.[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:5-28>) After his dismissal, Kohli attended his father's funeral. His innings proved to be crucial for Delhi as they were able to avoid the [follow-on](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Follow-on> "Follow-on"). The team's captain, [Mithun Manhas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mithun_Manhas> "Mithun Manhas"), praised Kohli for his performance, acknowledging its pivotal role in the team's success.[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:5-28>)
Kohli's foray into [T20](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Twenty20> "Twenty20") cricket first happened in April 2007, during the [Inter-State T20 Championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Inter-State_T20_Championship> "Inter-State T20 Championship"), where he emerged as the top run-getter for his team with a tally of 179 runs at an average of 35.80.[[27]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-29>) In Sep 2008, Kohli played in [Nissar Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Nissar_Trophy> "Nissar Trophy") against [SNGPL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sui_Northern_Gas_Pipelines_Limited_cricket_team> "Sui Northern Gas Pipelines Limited cricket team"). He emerged as the leading scorer for Delhi in both innings, registering 52 runs in the first innings and a towering 197 in the second. The match ultimately ended in a [draw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Draw_\(cricket\)> "Draw \(cricket\)"), SNGPL being declared the victors due to their lead in first innings.[[28]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-30>) In the [2009–10 Ranji Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_Ranji_Trophy> "2009–10 Ranji Trophy") season, Kohli returned to domestic cricket. During a match against [Maharashtra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Maharashtra_cricket_team> "Maharashtra cricket team"), he opened the batting and scored 67 runs, helping Delhi to secure the bonus point required for victory.[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-31>) Kohli's performance reinvigorated the competitive spirit of the domestic cricket circuit. 
> I did not see him waste his time. If not on the field, he would be busy in the gym. I saw him first as a chubby-cheeked bubbly young kid who grew into a perfect athlete. His junior cricket lessons have obviously helped him. I did not know him well, but had heard a lot about his exploits in junior cricket.
> — [Ashish Nehra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ashish_Nehra> "Ashish Nehra"), [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>)
### India U19 team
In July 2006, Kohli was selected in the [India Under-19](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/India_Under-19_cricket_team> "India Under-19 cricket team") squad on its tour of [England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/England> "England"). He averaged 105 in the three-match [ODI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/One_Day_International> "One Day International") series against [England Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/England_Under-19_cricket_team> "England Under-19 cricket team"),[[30]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-32>) while also averaging 49 in the 3-match [Test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Test_cricket> "Test cricket") series.[[31]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-33>) Following India U-19 success in both the ODI and Test series, the team's coach [Lalchand Rajput](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Lalchand_Rajput> "Lalchand Rajput") noted Kohli's adeptness in facing both [pace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Fast_bowling> "Fast bowling") and [spin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Spin_bowling> "Spin bowling") [bowling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Bowling_\(cricket\)> "Bowling \(cricket\)") and expressed his admiration for his technical prowess.[[32]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-34>) In September, the U-19 team toured Pakistan. In the first Test match, Kohli scored 63 and 28 as India won by 271 runs against [Pakistan Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pakistan_national_under-19_cricket_team> "Pakistan national under-19 cricket team"). In the 2nd match, he contributed 83 runs to India's victory by 240 runs [and an innings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Innings_win> "Innings win"). He concluded the tour with 80 runs in the final ODI game at Lahore.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>) In early 2007, Kohli was a part of the India U-19 team that toured New Zealand, where he scored 113 in the first Test match. The series ended in a draw. In the following month, the team travelled to Malaysia for a tri-series against England Under-19s and [Sri Lanka Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sri_Lanka_Under-19_cricket_team> "Sri Lanka Under-19 cricket team"), where Kohli did not get many opportunities to bat. In July–August, India U-19 embarked on a tour for a tri-series against Sri Lanka Under-19s and [Bangladesh Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Bangladesh_Under-19_cricket_team> "Bangladesh Under-19 cricket team"), where he did not score a half-century in any of the matches. He made a comeback with scores of 144 and an unbeaten 94 in the following Test series.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>)
Kohli came into the limelight in 2008 when he led the team to victory in the U-19 World Cup. He led the [Indian squad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup_squads#India> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup squads") and won the [2008 U-19 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup") held in [Malaysia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Malaysia> "Malaysia").[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-35>) He amassed 235 runs at an average of 47, ranking as the tournament's third-highest scorer and one of three cricketers to compile a century.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-36>) His century, a knock of 100 runs off 74 balls, versus the [West Indies Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/West_Indies_Under-19_cricket_team> "West Indies Under-19 cricket team") in a group stage encounter, was lauded by _[ESPNcricinfo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ESPNcricinfo> "ESPNcricinfo")_ , as "the innings of the tournament." This innings paved the way for India's 50-run triumph and fetched Kohli the [man of the match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Player_of_the_match> "Player of the match") award.[[35]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-onestowatch-37>) Additionally, Kohli's all-round performance in the [semi-final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup#Super_Semi-finals> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup") against [New Zealand Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/New_Zealand_Under-19_cricket_team> "New Zealand Under-19 cricket team"), where he captured 2 [wickets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wicket> "Wicket") and contributed 43 runs in the [run-chase](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Run-chase> "Run-chase"), was core to India's victory.[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-38>) In the [championship match](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup#Final> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup"), Kohli managed a score of 19 against [South Africa Under-19s](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/South_Africa_Under-19_cricket_team> "South Africa Under-19 cricket team") and his contribution lead to the eventual 12-run win (via [D/L method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Duckworth%E2%80%93Lewis_method> "Duckworth–Lewis method")).[[37]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-39>)
In June 2008, Kohli and his U-19 teammates [Pradeep Sangwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pradeep_Sangwan> "Pradeep Sangwan") and [Tanmay Srivastava](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tanmay_Srivastava> "Tanmay Srivastava") were awarded the Border–Gavaskar scholarship. This scholarship, aimed at honing the skills of the chosen cricketers, provided an opportunity to train for six weeks at [Cricket Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cricket_Australia> "Cricket Australia")'s Centre of Excellence in Brisbane.[[38]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-40>) In a bid to identify potential talent for the senior team, Kohli was selected to represent India Emerging Players in the Emerging Players Tournament 2008. His finest performance in the tournament was against New Zealand Emerging Players, where he played a knock of 120 runs, leading India to a seven-wicket victory. With an aggregate of 204 runs, Kohli's performances did not go unnoticed by the selectors who were observing his progress. He began his [international cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/International_cricket> "International cricket") journey by joining the senior team in [Colombo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Colombo> "Colombo"), having played 28 Under-19 ODIs and 12 Under-19 Tests.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>)

### Debut and maiden stint (2008–2009)
In 2008, Kohli was included in the ODl squad for the [Sri Lanka tour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_cricket_team_in_Sri_Lanka_in_2008> "Indian cricket team in Sri Lanka in 2008") and the [Champions Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009_ICC_Champions_Trophy> "2009 ICC Champions Trophy").[[39]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-41>) He was required to fill the role of makeshift opener throughout the Sri Lankan series.[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-42>) On August 18, 2008, Kohli made his international debut at the age of 19 in the first ODI of the tour.[[41]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-43>) In the 4th match of the series, Kohli scored his first half century in ODl consisting of fifty-four runs.[[42]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-odiinnlist-44>)
He was picked in the [India A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/India_A> "India A") squad for the Tests against [Australia A](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Australia_A_cricket_team> "Australia A cricket team") in September.[[43]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-45>) Despite limited opportunities, he managed to make an impact in the single innings that he participated in, scoring 49 runs.[[44]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-46>) In Oct, Kohli participate in a four-day tour match against Australia as part of the [Indian Board President's XI team](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Board_President%27s_XI_\(India\)> "Board President's XI \(India\)"). The match featured a formidable Australian bowling line-up that consisted of [Brett Lee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Brett_Lee> "Brett Lee"), [Stuart Clark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Stuart_Clark> "Stuart Clark"), [Mitchell Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mitchell_Johnson_\(cricketer\)> "Mitchell Johnson \(cricketer\)"), [Peter Siddle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Peter_Siddle> "Peter Siddle") and [Jason Krejza](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jason_Krejza> "Jason Krejza"). Despite this, Kohli scored 105 runs in the first innings, showing his ability to perform against top international competition.[[45]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-47>)
In December, Kohli was awarded a Grade D contract by the [Board of Control for Cricket in India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Board_of_Control_for_Cricket_in_India> "Board of Control for Cricket in India") as part of the annual contract list for the Indian national team which entitled him to receive ₹1.5 million (equivalent to ₹4.2 million or US$48,000 in 2023).[[46]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-48>)
In 2009, Kohli was selected in the four-team Emerging Players Tournament in Australia. He went on to have a standout performance and finished as the tournament's leading run-scorer, with a total of 398 runs from seven matches, at an average of 66.33. In the final match, he scored 104 runs off 102 balls against the South Africa Emerging Players in [Brisbane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Brisbane> "Brisbane"). His strong performance helped lead his team to a 17-run victory and the tournament title.[[47]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-49>)[[48]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-50>) [Kris Srikkanth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kris_Srikkanth> "Kris Srikkanth"), the chairman of the [Indian national selection committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/India_national_cricket_team_selectors> "India national cricket team selectors"), expressed his admiration for his performance during the tournament.[[49]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-51>) Kohli later stated that this tournament was a "turning point" in his career.[[50]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-52>)
In August, Kohli was a part of the Indian squad for the [tri-series in Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tri-Series_in_Sri_Lanka_in_2009> "Tri-Series in Sri Lanka in 2009").[[51]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-53>) He was utilized as a middle order batsman in the [2009 Champions Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009_ICC_Champions_Trophy> "2009 ICC Champions Trophy").[[52]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-54>) In December, he was included in the team for the [ODI series against Sri Lanka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sri_Lankan_cricket_team_in_India_in_2009%E2%80%9310> "Sri Lankan cricket team in India in 2009–10") and scored 27 and 54 in the first two ODIs.[[53]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-55>) Kohli scored his maiden ODI century, 107 off 114 balls while sharing a 224 run partnership with [Gautam Gambhir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gautam_Gambhir> "Gautam Gambhir"). As a result, India won by seven wickets and sealed the series 3–1.[[54]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:7-56>)[[c]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-57>)
### Rise through the ranks (2010–2011)
In January 2010, Kohli played the [tri-nation ODI tournament in Bangladesh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tri-Series_in_Bangladesh_in_2009%E2%80%9310> "Tri-Series in Bangladesh in 2009–10").[[55]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-58>) During the series, he became just the third Indian player to score two ODI centuries before the age of 22.[[56]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-59>) He was widely hailed for his performances, and ultimately emerged as the leading run-scorer of the series, with 275 runs from 5 innings at an impressive average of 91.66.[[57]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-60>) His initial foray into leadership on an international level occurred in May to June 2010, when he was appointed as vice-captain for the [tri-series against Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2010_Zimbabwe_Tri-Nation_Series> "2010 Zimbabwe Tri-Nation Series"). Despite an early setback, Kohli managed to become the fastest Indian batsman at the time to reach 1,000 runs in ODI cricket, achieving this milestone in 24 innings.[[58]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-61>) He also made his [International T20](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Twenty20_International> "Twenty20 International") debut against [Zimbabwe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Zimbabwe_national_cricket_team> "Zimbabwe national cricket team") at [Harare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Harare> "Harare"), where he scored an unbeaten 26.[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-62>) During the [2010 Asia Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2010_Asia_Cup> "2010 Asia Cup"), he was included in the team and was given batting at number 3. 
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/VIRAT_KHOLI_%26_DUNCAN_FLETCHER_%2815570557124%29.jpg/220px-VIRAT_KHOLI_%26_DUNCAN_FLETCHER_%2815570557124%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:VIRAT_KHOLI_%26_DUNCAN_FLETCHER_\(15570557124\).jpg>)Kohli with [Duncan Fletcher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Duncan_Fletcher> "Duncan Fletcher")
He faced some struggles with form but was retained in the ODI squad for a [three-match series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Australian_cricket_team_in_India_in_2010%E2%80%9311#ODI_series> "Australian cricket team in India in 2010–11") against [Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Australia_national_cricket_team> "Australia national cricket team") in October. Kohli scored a century, earning him the man of the match award.[[60]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-63>) During the home [ODI series against New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/New_Zealand_cricket_team_in_India_in_2010%E2%80%9311> "New Zealand cricket team in India in 2010–11"), Kohli scored another match-winning century, marking his fourth ODI hundred and second in succession.[[61]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-64>) The Indian team emerged victorious with a 5–0 [whitewash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Whitewash_\(sport\)#Cricket> "Whitewash \(sport\)") over [New Zealand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/New_Zealand> "New Zealand") and his performances solidified his position in the ODI team, making him a strong candidate for a spot in India's World Cup squad.[[62]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-65>)[[63]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-66>) He was India's leading run-scorer in ODIs in 2010, accumulating 995 runs from 25 matches at an average of 47.38, including three centuries and seven half-centuries.[[64]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-stat2010-67>)
> He is a very physical type of player. He likes to impose himself on the game, backs it up with his skill.
> — [Dav Whatmore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Dav_Whatmore> "Dav Whatmore"), [[65]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-68>)
Kohli was India's leading run scorer in the five-match ODI series at the [South African tour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_cricket_team_in_South_Africa_in_2010%E2%80%9311> "Indian cricket team in South Africa in 2010–11") in January 2011, with 193 runs including two fifties.[[66]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-69>) During the series, he jumped to number two spot on the [ICC Rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ICC_Men%27s_Player_Rankings> "ICC Men's Player Rankings") for men's ODI batters,[[67]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-kohliraina-70>) and was named in India's 15-man [squad for the World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Cricket_World_Cup_squads#India> "2011 Cricket World Cup squads").[[68]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-71>)
Kohli scored an unbeaten 100 in the first match against Bangladesh and became the first Indian batsman to score a century on his World Cup debut.[[69]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-72>) In the [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Cricket_World_Cup_Final> "2011 Cricket World Cup Final") against Sri Lanka at Mumbai, he scored 35, sharing an 83 runs partnership with Gambhir for the third wicket after India had lost both openers within seven overs while chasing 275.[[70]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-73>)[[71]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:8-74>)
When [India toured the West Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_cricket_team_in_the_West_Indies_in_2011> "Indian cricket team in the West Indies in 2011") in June and July 2011, Kohli was one of the three uncapped players in the Test squad.[[72]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-75>) He made his Test debut at [Kingston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sabina_Park> "Sabina Park") in the first match.[[73]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-testinnlist-76>) India went on to win the series 1–0 but Kohli amassed just 76 runs from five innings, struggling against the short ball.[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-77>)
Kohli later scored his sixth ODI hundred, 107 runs off 93 balls with a 170 run partnership with [Rahul Dravid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rahul_Dravid> "Rahul Dravid") who was playing his last ODI match.[[75]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-78>) It was the only century in the series by any player of either team.[[76]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-79>)
In October 2011, Kohli was the leading run scorer of the [five-match home ODI series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/English_cricket_team_in_India_in_2011%E2%80%9312> "English cricket team in India in 2011–12") against England which India won 5–0. He scored a total of 270 runs across 5 matches at an average of 90. This included unbeaten knock of 112 from 98 balls at [Delhi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Feroz_Shah_Kotla> "Feroz Shah Kotla"), where he put on an unbroken 209 run partnership with Gambhir;[[77]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-mom6-80>) followed by innings of 86 at [Mumbai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wankhede_Stadium> "Wankhede Stadium"), both the knocks came in successful run chases.[[78]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-81>) Owing to his ODI success, Kohli was included in the Test squad to [face the West Indies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/West_Indian_cricket_team_in_India_in_2011%E2%80%9312> "West Indian cricket team in India in 2011–12") in November. He was selected in the final match at Mumbai in which he scored a pair of fifties.[[79]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-82>) India won the subsequent ODI series 4–1 in which Kohli accumulated 243 runs at 60.75.[[80]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-83>) He also scored his 8th ODI century and his second at [Visakhapatnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Dr._Y._S._Rajasekhara_Reddy_International_Cricket_Stadium> "Dr. Y. S. Rajasekhara Reddy International Cricket Stadium"), where he made 117 off 123 balls in India's run chase of 270.[[81]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-mom7-84>) A knock which raised his reputation as "an expert of the chase".[[82]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-85>) Kohli ended up as the leading run-getter in ODIs for the year 2011, with 1381 runs from 34 matches at 47.62 including four centuries and eight fifties.[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-stat2011-86>)
During [tour of Australia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_cricket_team_in_Australia_in_2011%E2%80%9312> "Indian cricket team in Australia in 2011–12") in Dec 2011, he top scored in each of India's innings in the third Test at [Perth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/WACA_Ground> "WACA Ground") with scores of 44 and 75.[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-87>) In the fourth and final match at [Adelaide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Adelaide_Oval> "Adelaide Oval"), Kohli scored his maiden Test century, 116 runs in the first innings.[[85]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-88>) India suffered a 0–4 whitewash and Kohli was India's top run-scorer in the series. He was described as "the lone bright spot in an otherwise nightmare visit for the tourists."[[86]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-89>)

### Beginnings with RCB (2007)
In 2007, the Board of Control for Cricket in India introduced the [Indian Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_Premier_League> "Indian Premier League"), a franchise-based T20 league. Among the franchises, [Royal Challengers Bangalore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore> "Royal Challengers Bangalore"), owned by [Vijay Mallya](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Vijay_Mallya> "Vijay Mallya") at the time, selected Kohli to join their team for a sum of $50,000 through a draft. This decision was influenced by his performance in the U19 World Cup in Malaysia which India won under him.[[87]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-90>)
### Early seasons (2008–2009)
In the inaugural IPL match, Kohli played in a high-stakes encounter against the [Kolkata Knight Riders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kolkata_Knight_Riders> "Kolkata Knight Riders") where he lost his wicket early during the team's pursuit of a target of 223 runs.[[88]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-91>) As the event progressed, he found himself occupying a position in the [middle order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Middle-order> "Middle-order"), but he was reinstated at the [top order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Top-order_batsman> "Top-order batsman") during the match against [Deccan Charges](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Deccan_Chargers> "Deccan Chargers"). It was in this role that he rediscovered his form and made contributions to the cause.[[89]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-92>)
However, in the last two games, he had to sacrifice his preferred position in order to accommodate [Misbah-ul-Haq](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Misbah-ul-Haq> "Misbah-ul-Haq"), taking on the responsibility of batting in the middle order once again.[[90]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-93>) Concluding the [season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Indian_Premier_League> "2008 Indian Premier League"), Kohli's individual performance yielded a total of 165 runs, as Bangalore secured the seventh position on the points table.[[91]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-94>)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Against_Pune_Warriors.jpg/250px-Against_Pune_Warriors.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Against_Pune_Warriors.jpg>)Kohli batting against [Pune Warriors India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pune_Warriors_India> "Pune Warriors India").
In the subsequent [season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009_Indian_Premier_League> "2009 Indian Premier League"), Kohli encountered a series of low scores in the initial 2 matches before bouncing back with a half-century in the third match against Deccan Chargers, in team's defeat.[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-95>) Throughout the remainder of the season, Kohli displayed moderate performances or found limited opportunities to bat, owing to the dominance of top-order batsmen [Jacques Kallis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jacques_Kallis> "Jacques Kallis") and [Ross Taylor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ross_Taylor> "Ross Taylor"). This proved advantageous for the team, as they secured a spot in the playoffs.[[93]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-96>) In the [semi-final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009_Indian_Premier_League#Playoffs> "2009 Indian Premier League") against [Chennai Super Kings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Chennai_Super_Kings> "Chennai Super Kings"), Kohli made contributions to the chase, leading Bangalore to the final.[[94]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-97>) In [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2009_Indian_Premier_League_final> "2009 Indian Premier League final") against Deccan Charges, Bangalore fell short by a margin of 8 runs, thus concluding the [season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore_in_2009> "Royal Challengers Bangalore in 2009") as runners-up.[[95]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-98>)
### Rise, retention and realization (2010–2012)
In the [2010 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2010_Indian_Premier_League> "2010 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli was the vice-captain for RCB and was positioned in the middle order. He augmented Bangalore's batting depth and made contributions to the team's success. Notably, his contribution was observed during a victory over the [Kings XI Punjab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kings_XI_Punjab> "Kings XI Punjab"), where he played an instrumental role in concluding the match.[[96]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-99>) His cameos in away fixtures against the Chennai Super Kings[[97]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-100>) and Kings XI Punjab, forging valuable partnerships, particularly with Kevin Pietersen, were crucial.[[98]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-101>) Kohli's standout performance came in an encounter against the Deccan Chargers, where he scored 58 runs at a strike rate of 165.[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-102>) As the season progressed, Kohli's fielding prowess also came to the fore, furthering his contribution to the team's cause.[[100]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-103>) Upon securing a place in the playoffs, the Bangalore team confronted [Mumbai Indians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mumbai_Indians> "Mumbai Indians") in the [semi-final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2010_Indian_Premier_League#Semi-final_1> "2010 Indian Premier League"). Bangalore suffered a setback, succumbing to a defeat margin of 35 runs, thus ending Bangalore's campaign in the tournament.[[101]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-104>) In the [Champions League Twenty20](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Champions_League_Twenty20> "Champions League Twenty20") held in September, Bangalore found themselves in an encounter against the [Mumbai Indians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mumbai_Indians> "Mumbai Indians"). In pursuit of a target of 165 runs, Kohli played a steady innings, contributing 47 runs. The match came to the final ball, which resulted in Kohli's dismissal, leading to Bangalore falling short by a margin of 2 runs.[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-105>) As a consequence, their upcoming game against the [Lions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Highveld_Lions_cricket_team> "Highveld Lions cricket team") became a virtual knockout match. In this must-win encounter, Kohli scored 49* runs, guiding his team to victory, securing a place in the semi-finals.[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-106>) In the semi-final clash against the Chennai Super Kings, RCB faced a significant defeat of 52 runs. 
Prior to the [2011 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Indian_Premier_League> "2011 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli was the sole player retained by Bangalore, for an amount of US$1.8 million.[[104]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-107>) In the opening match against the [Kochi Tuskers Kerala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kochi_Tuskers_Kerala> "Kochi Tuskers Kerala"), Kohli started his campaign with a score of 23 runs.[[105]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-108>) He registered his first half-century of the season against the Deccan Chargers, in pursuit of what was then the second-highest run chase, however Bangalore fell short by 33 runs.[[106]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-109>) After lacklustre start for Bangalore, winning two out of their first six matches, Kohli scored 56 runs in the next match against the [Delhi Daredevils](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Delhi_Daredevils> "Delhi Daredevils"), and was awarded the player of the match for the first time in the tournament.[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-110>) In the subsequent match, he continued his form against the [Pune Warriors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pune_Warriors_India> "Pune Warriors India"), where he claimed his second player of the match award. It was during this match that Kohli became the leading run-scorer of the season, donning the [Orange cap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Orange_Cap> "Orange Cap"), and he also surpassed the milestone of 1000 runs in the IPL.[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-111>) With regular captain [Daniel Vettori](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Daniel_Vettori> "Daniel Vettori") sustaining an injury, Kohli had the opportunity to captain his side for the first time in an IPL match.[[109]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-112>) Team's coach, [Ray Jennings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ray_Jennings> "Ray Jennings") praised Kohli for his efforts, acknowledged his potential to become the future captain not only of the franchise but also of the Indian national team.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-113>) The team ended their league stage campaign on a high note, defeating the Chennai Super Kings and securing the top position on the table.[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-114>)
In the [first qualifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Indian_Premier_League#Qualifier_1> "2011 Indian Premier League"), Kohli scored 70 off 44 balls. Setting a target of 175 runs, RCB failed to defend, resulting in a knockout against the Mumbai Indians.[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-115>) In the knockout match, Bangalore triumphed over Mumbai, securing their place in the IPL final for the second time. In the [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_Indian_Premier_League_final> "2011 Indian Premier League final"), chasing a target of 205 runs, Kohli contributed 35 runs to the team's total. However, Bangalore once again fell short in their pursuit of the title.[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-116>) During the season, Kohli amassed 557 runs with 4 half-centuries, and earning the distinction of being the second-highest run-scorer of the season, trailing West-Indian teammate [Chris Gayle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Chris_Gayle> "Chris Gayle").[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-117>) In the Champions League, RCB encountered a defeat in their first match against the [Warriors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Warriors_\(cricket_team\)> "Warriors \(cricket team\)"). In the following match, Kohli got dismissed for a duck, leading to another loss for Bangalore. To secure a spot in the semi-finals, they needed to win their remaining two matches. In their last group-stage match against the [Southern Redbacks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Southern_Redbacks> "Southern Redbacks"), Kohli showcased his aggressive batting by scoring 70 runs off just 36 balls, propelling Bangalore into the semi-finals.[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-118>) In the semi-final clash against the [New South Wales Blues](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/New_South_Wales_cricket_team> "New South Wales cricket team"), Kohli once again played match-winning innings, scoring an unbeaten 84 runs.[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-119>) However, in the final showdown against the Mumbai Indians, Bangalore suffered a defeat by a margin of 31 runs. 
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Kohli_during_rcb_green_jersey_match.jpg/156px-Kohli_during_rcb_green_jersey_match.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Kohli_during_rcb_green_jersey_match.jpg>)Kohli playing against [CSK](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Chennai_Super_Kings> "Chennai Super Kings") during [2014 IPL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2014_IPL> "2014 IPL")
In the [2012 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2012_Indian_Premier_League> "2012 Indian Premier League"), Kohli had single-digit scores in the first 2 matches but bounced back in the 3rd match against the Chennai Super Kings, scoring 57 runs.[[117]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-120>) He reached a total of 165 runs by the 9tg game.[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-121>) He managed to contribute 45 runs in the next match against the Kings XI Punjab to his team's cause.[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-122>) As the season progressed, ineffectiveness of Bangalore's captain, Daniel Vettori, as a player led to a strategic alteration. Vettori made the decision to step down as captain and handed the leadership role to Kohli for the remaining matches of the season.[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-123>) His breakthrough performance in the season came during the match against the Delhi Daredevils where he scored 73* and formed a record-breaking partnership of 203 runs with his teammate Gayle.[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-124>) In their final match of the season, Bangalore faced the Deccan Chargers with the necessity of must-win to qualify for the playoffs. Kohli contributed 42 runs to the team's chase before being dismissed in the 16th over. His dismissal triggered a collapse in Bangalore's batting order, resulting in their eventual defeat and elimination from the tournament during the group stage.[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-125>) During the season, Kohli accumulated a total of 364 runs, garnered over the course of 16 matches. He returned from the League with a sense of disillusionment with his own performance and was dissatisfied with the state of his game. He recognized the need for improvement and adaptation to the evolving dynamics of cricket.[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-126>)
### Leadership role (2013–2014)
Following Vettori's retirement, Kohli assumed the role of full-time captain for the Bangalore team starting from the [2013 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2013_Indian_Premier_League> "2013 Indian Premier League") of the IPL. Prior to the commencement of this season, he was highest run-scorer for Bangalore with a tally of 1,639 runs.[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-127>) Kohli embarked on the tournament with a consistent start, but suffered a loss against the [Sunrisers Hyderabad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sunrisers_Hyderabad> "Sunrisers Hyderabad") in an away game.[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-128>) In their subsequent home match, once again against Hyderabad, Kohli scored unbeaten 93 while chasing, marking his highest individual score in Twenty20 cricket at that time.[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-129>) Continuing his form, Kohli went on to score back-to-back fifties in the matches against the Chennai Super Kings and the Delhi Daredevils, the latter of which was decided through a [super over](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Super_Over> "Super Over").[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-130>) After a defeat against the Mumbai Indians, Kohli found himself embroiled in a disagreement with the crowd due to their aggressive demeanour towards the visiting team at the [Wankhede Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wankhede_Stadium> "Wankhede Stadium").[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-131>) As the mid-season approached, Kohli encountered a dip in his performance, managing 45 runs in four innings.[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-132>) He bounced back during the away game against Delhi, where he came close to achieving a century, scoring 99 before being run out on the final delivery.[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-133>) With a strong start to the season that saw Bangalore occupying the top position in the table, the team's performance waned in the latter half of the tournament.[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-134>) Kohli openly addressed the issue, attributing their decline to a lack of execution by the bowling unit.[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-135>) In a bid to keep their playoff hopes alive, Bangalore confronted a must-win scenario in their final match against Chennai. Opening the innings, Kohli scored an unbeaten 56 in a rain-affected match, ultimately leading his team to victory.[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-136>) However, Bangalore's hopes were shattered when the Hyderabad secured a win over the Kolkata Knight Riders, dashing their chances of advancing to the playoffs. As a result, [Bangalore's season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore_in_2013> "Royal Challengers Bangalore in 2013") came to an end during the group stage.[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-137>)
Prior to the [seventh season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2014_Indian_Premier_League> "2014 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli was retained by Bangalore for ₹12.5 crore (US$1.4 million).[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-138>) His campaign commenced with an unbeaten score of 49 runs in a victorious encounter against the Delhi Daredevils.[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-139>) However, Kohli struggled to maintain his form and faced a dismissal without scoring in the second match. In a match against the [Rajasthan Royals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rajasthan_Royals> "Rajasthan Royals"), Bangalore's batting lineup faltered, resulting in them being bowled out for 70, then third-lowest total in IPL history. Kohli contributed 21 runs to the team's total in that particular match.[[137]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-140>) Bangalore heavily relied on the performances of Gayle and Kohli in their batting lineup, but neither of them had managed a significant innings thus far in the season.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:26-141>) Kohli's struggles persisted as he recorded his third duck of the season in a match against the Kings XI Punjab.[[139]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-142>) In an effort to address the batting woes, Kohli made the decision to alter his batting position and open the innings; however, this adjustment did not yield the desired outcome.[[140]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-143>) With Bangalore losing six out of their nine games, Kohli had yet to reach the milestone of scoring a half-century. Meanwhile, the team was striving to secure victories in their remaining matches in order to qualify for the playoffs.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:26-141>) In his twelfth game of the season against the Sunrisers Hyderabad, Kohli achieved his first fifty of the season. However, the subsequent defeat to the Kolkata Knight Riders, with Kohli contributing 38 runs before being dismissed by [Sunil Narine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sunil_Narine> "Sunil Narine") for the second time, led to Bangalore's elimination from playoff contention for the third consecutive time.[[141]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-144>) In their final match of the season against the Chennai Super Kings, Kohli showcased his best performance of the season, accumulating 73 runs. However, Bangalore suffered a defeat in that match.[[142]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-145>) Despite the team's challenges, Kohli's popularity continued to soar, making him the most-searched player on the [internet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Internet> "Internet") during the tournament.[[143]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-146>)
### Collective and individual success (2015–2016)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/42/Virat_Kohli_at_the_2015_IPL_opening_ceremony_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Virat_Kohli_at_the_2015_IPL_opening_ceremony_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_at_the_2015_IPL_opening_ceremony_\(cropped\).jpg>)Kohli as the captain of the [Royal Challengers Bangalore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore> "Royal Challengers Bangalore") at the [2015 IPL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2015_Indian_Premier_League> "2015 Indian Premier League") Opening Ceremony
At the outset of the [2015 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2015_Indian_Premier_League> "2015 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli expressed his optimism about playing with reduced pressure, attributing it to the strengthened middle order of the Bangalore team.[[144]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-147>) Kohli strategically decided to open the batting alongside Gayle for the season. In the second match against the Sunrisers Hyderabad, he scored 41 runs, providing a moderate start to his campaign.[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-148>) Continuing his form, Kohli achieved his first half-century of the season, albeit in a match that ended in defeat against the Chennai Super Kings.[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-149>) In the subsequent match, Kohli again notched a fifty, leading Bangalore to victory and ending their three-match losing streak.[[147]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-150>) During this match, he promoted [AB de Villiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/AB_de_Villiers> "AB de Villiers") up the batting order, recognizing the importance of having the team's premier batsman face more deliveries.[[148]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-151>) Bangalore, looking to overcome their previous struggles in the bowling department, successfully bowled out the Delhi Daredevils for 95 runs, while Kohli guided his team to a ten-wicket victory during the chase.[[149]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-152>) However, in an away game against Chennai, Kohli fell short of reaching a half-century, scoring 48 runs before being run out by [Dwayne Bravo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Dwayne_Bravo> "Dwayne Bravo") due to a momentary lapse in judgment. Bangalore's loss in that match marked the end of their winning streak.[[150]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-153>) His standout innings of the season came against the Mumbai Indians, where he played a knock of 82 runs, forming a then record partnership of 215 runs with de Villiers.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-154>) In a rain-affected match against the Hyderabad, with a target of 83 runs to chase in six overs, Kohli scored quickfire 44 off 19 balls, earning him player of the match award.[[152]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-155>) In the subsequent game, Kohli found himself entangled in an incident involving an anti-corruption code breach. Nonetheless, he managed to continue playing due to breach's absence of severity.[[153]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-156>) Qualifying for the playoffs for the first time under his captaincy, Kohli held firm confidence in the turnaround his team had showcased during the later stages of the league.[[154]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-157>) However, in the [qualifier 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2015_Indian_Premier_League#Qualifier_2> "2015 Indian Premier League") against Chennai, Kohli's dismissal for 12 runs proved detrimental to Bangalore's chances, resulting in their defeat and the conclusion of their campaign for the season. Throughout the season, Kohli accumulated a total of 505 runs in 16 matches with an average of 45.90, then third-highest run tally achieved by him in a single season.[[155]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-158>)
In the [2016 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2016_Indian_Premier_League> "2016 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli's campaign began with 75 runs, contributing to a victory of 45 runs against the Sunrisers Hyderabad.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-159>) He continued his run in the subsequent match, scoring 79 runs. Throughout the early matches, Kohli consistently achieved the milestone of scoring half-centuries in three out of the four matches he played, while sharing three century partnerships with de Villiers.[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-160>) In the encounter against the [Gujarat Lions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gujarat_Lions> "Gujarat Lions"), he registered his first century in Twenty20 cricket. Although the match ended in defeat for his team, Kohli's knock earned him the player of the match.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-161>) Despite Kohli's performances, Bangalore struggled in the league stage, securing only two victories out of their seven matches and finding themselves in the seventh position on the points table.[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-162>) To revive their chances of qualifying for the playoffs, Bangalore needed to win six out of their next seven matches. In the subsequent match, Kohli scored a century in a successful chase against [Rising Pune Supergiant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rising_Pune_Supergiant> "Rising Pune Supergiant") as Bangalore's virtual knockouts began.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-163>) He continued to deliver match-winning performances, forming a record partnership of 229 runs with de Villiers against the Gujarat,[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-164>) followed by playing a knock of 75* against the Kolkata Knight Riders.[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-165>) In a rain-affected match against the Kings XI Punjab, Kohli achieved his fourth century of the season, surpassing the milestone of 4,000 runs in the league.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-166>) His batting drew high praise from [Harsha Bhogle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Harsha_Bhogle> "Harsha Bhogle"), who lauded his technical proficiency and shot-making.[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-167>) Kohli's consistent performances propelled Bangalore to the playoffs, as he scored four consecutive fifty-plus scores in must-win matches and finished the league stage with tally of 919 runs.[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-168>) In the playoffs, Bangalore faced Gujarat in the [first qualifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2016_Indian_Premier_League#Qualifier_1> "2016 Indian Premier League"). Kohli was dismissed for a duck in that match, however his team emerged victorious, setting up a [final](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2016_Indian_Premier_League_final> "2016 Indian Premier League final") against the Hyderabad.[[166]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-169>) Kohli contributed 54 runs in Bangalore's pursuit of target of 209 in the final. Notwithstanding, Bangalore fell short by a margin of 8 runs, leaving him to acknowledge the Hyderabad team's performance and express his gratitude to the Bangalore crowd for their support.[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-170>) Kohli concluded the season with record 973 runs in 16 matches, at an average of 81.08, establishing himself as the highest run-scorer of the tournament and claiming Orange Cap with the title of Most Valuable Player.[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-171>) Team's coach, Vettori, praised Kohli for his contributions, stating:[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-172>)
> Virat has been phenomenal. When you have got a guy at the top of the order who takes that much control and his performances are that great, it allows things to flow from there. Obviously a great captain does that — leads with his performance and he has been exceptional not only with his batting, but also fielding and leadership.
### Fluctuating form and captaincy struggles (2017–2019)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Kohli_ruling_despite_RCB_collapse.jpg/250px-Kohli_ruling_despite_RCB_collapse.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Kohli_ruling_despite_RCB_collapse.jpg>)Kohli celebrating his fifty against [Mumbai Indians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mumbai_Indians> "Mumbai Indians")
In the lead-up to the [tenth season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2017_Indian_Premier_League> "2017 Indian Premier League") of the IPL, Kohli grappled with a shoulder injury, which sidelined him for the initial three fixtures of the tournament.[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-173>) Upon his return in the fourth match against the Mumbai Indians, he scored 62 runs, albeit in a defeat for Bangalore.[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-174>) Following this performance, Kohli delivered moderately in the subsequent two matches. However, in the face-off against the Kolkata Knight Riders, Kohli faced a setback after being dismissed for a duck as Bangalore stumbled to league's lowest score of 49 runs. He promptly criticized the batting display as reckless.[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-175>) In the encounter against the Rising Pune Supergiant, Kohli contributed 55 runs to his team's total of 96 runs. Expressing disappointment, Kohli attributed the team's struggles to a lack of intent and a fearful batting approach.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-176>) With Bangalore facing defeat in seven out of their ten matches, their hopes for playoffs were dashed, particularly after their loss to the Mumbai Indians, making them the first team to be eliminated from contention.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-177>) Wrapping up the tournament, Bangalore secured a victory in their last match against Delhi Daredevils, with Kohli scoring his fourth fifty of the season and amassing a total of 308 runs in 10 innings.[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-178>) Kohli concluded that the season as a whole was the team's most underwhelming performance to date.[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-179>) Commemorating the ten-year anniversary of the league, _ESPNcricinfo_ honoured Kohli by including him in the all-time IPL-XI.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-180>)
> "He is a consummate surgeon at the crease, intensely focused, working hard, playing the ball into gaps in the field and staying calm under pressure. He is always judging the right time to consolidate and the right time to seize a game by the scruff of the neck." 
– Kohli's [RCB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore> "Royal Challengers Bangalore") team mate [AB de Villiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/AB_de_Villiers> "AB de Villiers")
Prior to the commencement of the [2018 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2018_Indian_Premier_League> "2018 Indian Premier League"), Bangalore retained Kohli for sum of ₹17 crore (US$1.9 million), making him the league's most expensive player at the time.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-181>) His campaign began with 33 runs in a defeat against the Kolkata Knight Riders, where he expressed his discontentment with the number of dot balls he faced.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-182>) In contrast to his individual performances, which included twin fifties in the third and fourth matches, temporarily securing him the Orange Cap, Bangalore found themselves consistently on the losing side.[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-183>) This predicament was primarily attributed to the team's heavy reliance on Kohli and his partner de Villiers in the batting lineup, coupled with their challenges in the bowling department, which Kohli critiqued as being "criminal".[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-184>) As the tournament progressed, Bangalore gradually discovered their winning rhythm, propelled by Kohli's contributions, including scores of 70 and 48* in must-win encounters against Delhi Daredevils and Kings XI Punjab, respectively.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-185>) He eventually surpassed the milestone of 500 runs in the season, a feat he accomplished for a record fifth time.[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-186>) However, in the decisive encounter against the Rajasthan Royals, Kohli faltered, managing 4 runs before succumbing to dismissal. This setback ultimately led to Bangalore's elimination from the tournament. In the aftermath of their exit, Kohli publicly scrutinized the team's middle-order batsmen for their failure to deliver substantial contributions during crucial matches, reflecting on the missed opportunities that defined their campaign.[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-187>)
Kohli's start to the [2019 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2019_Indian_Premier_League> "2019 Indian Premier League") proved underwhelming, as he managed 6 runs in the opener against the Chennai Super Kings.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-188>) Consequently, he opted to move down the batting order in an attempt to provide more depth. However, his struggle with form persisted, reflecting in Bangalore's losses and prompting a quick reversal of the decision.[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-189>) In an encounter against the Rajasthan Royals, Kohli marked his 100th appearance as Bangalore's captain.[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-190>) Albeit, that match ended in defeat, extending the team's losing streak to four consecutive matches. Former cricketer Gautam Gambhir weighed in on Kohli's lengthy tenure as captain, suggesting luck may have played a part despite his underwhelming performance as leader.[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-191>) Kohli eventually found his rhythm in the fifth match, where he managed to score a half-century against the Kolkata Knight Riders.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-192>) However, Bangalore's string of losses persisted, prompting him to acknowledge his team's lackluster performance thus far.[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-193>) After enduring record six consecutive defeats, Bangalore secured their first victory against the Kings XI Punjab, with Kohli contributing 67 runs in that match.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-194>) Subsequently, he scored his fifth century in the league;[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-195>) however, his subsequent form saw a dip, as he struggled to make significant contributions with the bat in Bangalore's successive victories. These wins, were not enough as Bangalore fell short in their bid to advance further in the tournament, marking their third consecutive elimination under Kohli's captaincy.[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-196>) Reflecting on the season, he expressed satisfaction with the team's turnaround in the latter stages of the tournament, acknowledging the progress made despite their early challenges.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-197>)
### Performance plunge and captaincy departure (2020–2022)
Following the resumption of cricket post the [COVID-19 lockdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/COVID-19_lockdown_in_India> "COVID-19 lockdown in India"), Kohli returned to the field with cautious optimism.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-198>) However, positioned at number 3, his start to the [2020 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2020_Indian_Premier_League> "2020 Indian Premier League") was lackluster, tallying a total of 18 runs across the first three matches. In the fourth match, Kohli found his rhythm, and scored 72 runs against the Rajasthan Royals.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-199>) His momentum continued as he played his standout innings of the season against the Chennai Super Kings, scoring an unbeaten 90.[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-200>) Throughout the season, Kohli adhered to a strategy of accumulating runs primarily through singles and doubles, thereby minimizing the reliance on boundaries.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-201>) Under his captaincy, Bangalore secured victories in five of their opening eight matches, with Kohli himself contributing moderately, amassing a total of 389 runs by the conclusion of eleven matches.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-202>) However, during the latter part of the season, Kohli's form dipped, coinciding with Bangalore's consecutive losses in four matches following their promising start.[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-203>) Despite these setbacks, Bangalore managed to qualify for the playoffs due to their [net run rate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Net_run_rate> "Net run rate").[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-204>) Kohli concluded the league stage with a cumulative total of 460 runs, albeit with a slower strike rate of 122. Analysts at _ESPNcricinfo_ attributed this performance in part to the distinctive conditions of the season, notably the relocation of matches to the [UAE](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/United_Arab_Emirates> "United Arab Emirates"), where larger boundaries and an inexperienced middle order might have influenced Kohli's risk-averse approach.[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-205>) In the playoffs, Bangalore encountered the Sunrisers Hyderabad in the [eliminator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2020_Indian_Premier_League#Eliminator> "2020 Indian Premier League"). Kohli, assuming the opening position alongside [Devdutt Padikkal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Devdutt_Padikkal> "Devdutt Padikkal"), encountered an early setback, scoring 7 runs before his dismissal. Bangalore succumbed in the knockout encounter, prompting Kohli to reflect on a palpable sense of nervousness among the players, which contributed to their defeat.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-206>)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/IPL_2021.jpg/250px-IPL_2021.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:IPL_2021.jpg>)Kohli captaining during a match in [IPL 2021](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/IPL_2021> "IPL 2021")
Ahead of the [2021 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2021_Indian_Premier_League> "2021 Indian Premier League") opener, Kohli emphasized the strategic advantages of neutral venues for his team.[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-207>) In their inaugural match against the Mumbai Indians, Kohli commenced with a score of 33, which he replicated in the subsequent fixture.[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-208>) Notably, his first half-century of the season came against the Rajasthan Royals, where he scored an unbeaten 72, leading Bangalore to secure victory in four consecutive encounters.[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-209>) Upon the resumption of the league in September, Kohli became the first player to make 200 appearances for a singular franchise.[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-210>) Concurrently, Kohli announced his intention to relinquish the captaincy of Bangalore at the season's end, this decision was met with speculation, with Sandip of _[The Indian Express](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/The_Indian_Express> "The Indian Express")_ suggesting that it could potentially afford Kohli to play with more freedom.[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-211>) In subsequent fixtures, Kohli scored consecutive half-centuries against the Chennai Super
