Kings[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-212>) and Mumbai, his innings against the latter also marked the completion of 10,000 runs in T20 cricket.[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-213>) As the tournament progressed, Bangalore qualified for the playoffs, with two games to spare, attributed to performances by [Glenn Maxwell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Glenn_Maxwell> "Glenn Maxwell") and [Harshal Patel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Harshal_Patel> "Harshal Patel") in their respective domains.[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-214>) However, Kohli experienced a dip in form leading up to the playoffs, as Bangalore prepared to face Kolkata Knight Riders in the [eliminator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2021_Indian_Premier_League#Eliminator> "2021 Indian Premier League"). In the knockout clash, where he notched up 39 runs, Bangalore was unable to secure victory, thus concluding Kohli's tenure as captain. In his post-match discourse, Kohli reaffirmed his commitment to delivering his utmost for Bangalore, while expressing gratitude for the loyalty and support extended by the franchise.[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-215>)
Prior to the onset of the [2022 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2022_Indian_Premier_League> "2022 Indian Premier League"), Bangalore chose to retain Kohli for a sum of ₹15 crore (US$1.7 million).[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-216>) With [Faf Du Plessis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Faf_du_Plessis> "Faf du Plessis") taking over the captaincy reins, Kohli commenced the season with a score of 41* against the Punjab Kings. However, positioned at number 3, Kohli's subsequent innings were marked by inconsistency, with sole significant contribution of 48 runs against the Mumbai Indians. Struggling to regain his form, Kohli endured two consecutive ducks in matches against the [Lucknow Super Giants](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Lucknow_Super_Giants> "Lucknow Super Giants") and Sunrisers Hyderabad. By the seventh match of the season, Kohli found himself registering single-digit scores in four out of seven matches, accumulating a total of 119 runs at an average of 17.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-217>) Cricket analyst [Jarrod Kimber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jarrod_Kimber> "Jarrod Kimber"), writing for _ESPNcricinfo_ , remarked that Kohli's batting seemed enigmatic and uncertain.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-218>) In an attempt to rectify his batting woes, Kohli was elevated to the opening position alongside du Plessis. It was in the tenth match that he managed to secure his maiden half-century of the season, albeit in 45 balls, marking it as his slowest in the T20 format.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-219>) However, his struggles persisted, as he encountered another duck against Hyderabad, accumulating a total of 216 runs in twelve matches.[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-220>) Former Indian coach [Ravi Shastri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ravi_Shastri> "Ravi Shastri") expressed his apprehension, suggesting that Kohli appeared "overcooked" and advocated for a break to rejuvenate himself. In concurrence with Shastri's assessment, Kohli asserted that he did not feel the need to prove himself to anyone and believed in his ability to bounce back.[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-221>) As the tournament progressed, Bangalore found themselves in a precarious position, requiring a victory in their final league match to remain in contention for the playoffs. Kohli rose to the occasion, scoring 73 runs against [Gujarat Titans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gujarat_Titans> "Gujarat Titans"), and propelling Bangalore to victory.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-222>) However, Kohli faltered in the subsequent eliminator and [qualifier 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2022_Indian_Premier_League#Qualifier_2> "2022 Indian Premier League"), spelling the culmination of [Bangalore's campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Royal_Challengers_Bangalore_in_2022> "Royal Challengers Bangalore in 2022"). 
### Milestones galore (2023–2024)
In the [2023 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2023_Indian_Premier_League> "2023 Indian Premier League"), Kohli commenced his campaign with a score of 82* runs against the Mumbai Indians.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-223>) He maintained his form in subsequent matches, registering fifties in three out of the first four matches. Kohli's batting approach during this period was marked by aggression in the [powerplay overs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Powerplay_\(cricket\)> "Powerplay \(cricket\)"), followed by a more cautious approach in the middle overs of the game. Reflecting on this tactical shift, Kohli noted that the middle overs are when teams typically introduce their premier bowlers, necessitating the assessment of the game's evolving dynamics.[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-224>) Moreover, in the absence of regular captain du Plessis, Kohli assumed the role of stand-in captain for several matches, while du Plessis contributed as an [impact player](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_Premier_League#Unique_rules_and_variations> "Indian Premier League").[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-225>) Eight matches into the season, Kohli had scored fifties in five of them.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-226>) However, an altercation marred a match against the Lucknow Super Giants, where Kohli found himself in a confrontation with Gambhir, resulting in a fine for breaching the code of conduct.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-227>) Throughout the season, Kohli relied on his placement and running between the wickets to maintain a scoring rate above a run a ball.[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-228>) As the season progressed, Bangalore needed victories in their final two games to clinch a spot in the playoffs. Kohli stepped up in a pivotal match against the Sunrisers Hyderabad, scoring a century, to secure a win for his team.[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-229>) In the subsequent fixture, he scored another century, surpassing Gayle for the most centuries in the league. However, Bangalore fell short in defending their total, leading to their elimination from the tournament. Kohli concluded the season with a tally of 639 runs at an average of 53.2 and a strike rate of 140.[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-230>)
In the [2024 season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2024_Indian_Premier_League> "2024 Indian Premier League"), Kohli began slow, scoring only 21 runs against the Chennai Super Kings, in a loss too.[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-231>) The next match however, he scored 77 runs against the Punjab Kings, a crucial knock, and he won Man of the Match. Kohli continued this type of form throughout the tournament, scoring 2 fifties in the first 4 games. In a game against the [Rajasthan Royals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rajasthan_Royals> "Rajasthan Royals"), Kohli scored 113*, which is his highest score in the IPL. However, he did it in 72 balls, which was 12 out of 20 overs. Bengaluru lost this match, and was on a 6 game losing streak,[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-232>) before Kohli scored another fifty that helped them win against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Kohli scored two more fifties in the next 3 matches, including an impressive 92 off just 47 and the runout of Shashank Singh.[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-233>) RCB won the next 2 games to qualify for the playoffs, and after being on a 6 game losing streak, turned around a came back with a 6 game winning streak. 
On 12 May 2024, Kohli added another feather to his hat as he took the field against [Delhi Capitals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Delhi_Capitals> "Delhi Capitals") (DC) at [M. Chinnaswamy Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/M._Chinnaswamy_Stadium> "M. Chinnaswamy Stadium") in [Bengaluru](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Bengaluru> "Bengaluru"). He became the first player in the history of the [Indian Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_Premier_League> "Indian Premier League") to play 250 matches for a single franchise.[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-234>)
In the eliminator game against the [Rajasthan Royals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rajasthan_Royals> "Rajasthan Royals"), Kohli surpassed the 8000 run mark. He was now 1000 runs apart from the second highest score in the IPL, [Shikhar Dhawan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Shikhar_Dhawan> "Shikhar Dhawan"). Kohli won his second Orange Cap award, with 741 runs scored and an average of 61.75.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-235>)[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-236>)
## Player profile
### Comparisons to Sachin Tendulkar
Kohli's batting style and approach to the game have frequently drawn comparisons to [Sachin Tendulkar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sachin_Tendulkar> "Sachin Tendulkar"), whom he regards as the epitome of excellence in the sport of cricket. Called Tendulkar's successor,[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-king2-237>)[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-donald2-238>) he is widely considered to have the potential to surpass his records.[[236]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-239>)[[237]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-240>) Kohli has stated he tried to mirror Tendulkar's style of batting, imitating his shots and attempting to hit sixes in a similar manner.[[238]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-241>)
His aggressive and dynamic style has earned him accolades from cricketing greats such as Vivian Richards, who has acknowledged Kohli's similarities to his own style.[[239]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-himself-242>) He has been lauded as the "new king of world cricket" by [Dean Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Dean_Jones_\(cricketer\)> "Dean Jones \(cricketer\)"), a former Australian cricketer.[[240]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-243>) Kohli's skills with the bat have earned him accolades from former West Indies great [Brian Lara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Brian_Lara> "Brian Lara"), who has ranked him among the best batsmen in the world.[[241]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-244>)
Tendulkar proclaimed that Kohli possesses the potential to surpass his record of 100 international centuries. He acknowledged Kohli's batting aptitude and steadfastness of accumulating runs.[[242]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-245>) In 2013, Tendulkar retired from international cricket, marking the end of an era for Indian cricket. Kohli played alongside Tendulkar in the team.[[243]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-246>)
In 2024, Kohli became the fastest player to score 27,000 runs in international cricket. He surpassed Tendulkar's record, achieving the feat in 594 innings compared to Tendulkar's 623, during the Test against Bangladesh at [Green Park Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Green_Park_Stadium> "Green Park Stadium"). Kohli now joins Ricky Ponting and Kumar Sangakkara as the only players to have crossed this milestone in international cricket.[[244]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-247>)
### Playing style
Kohli possesses technical abilities and a dynamic playing demeanour.[[245]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-248>)[[246]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-emerging-249>) His customarily batting position in ODl cricket is at number three with a slightly open-chested stance and a grip on the bottom handle of his bat.[[247]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-250>) He has been noted for his agile footwork, expansive range of strokes, and his propensity for adeptly orchestrating innings whilst thriving in high-pressure situations.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-251>)[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-252>) In his batting technique, Kohli tends to favour playing grounded shots rather than attempting big hits. He is appreciated for his ability to execute wrist shots and his consistent prowess in the [mid-wicket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Fielding_\(cricket\)> "Fielding \(cricket\)") and [cover](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cover_\(cricket\)> "Cover \(cricket\)") region.[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-253>)[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-254>)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG/220px-2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_%2803%29_%28cropped%29.JPG)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Kohli_\(03\)_\(cropped\).JPG>)Kohli playing his famous flick shot at the [2015 Cricket World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2015_Cricket_World_Cup> "2015 Cricket World Cup")
Kohli has often expressed his admiration for the [cover drive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cover_drive_\(cricket\)> "Cover drive \(cricket\)"), which he considers to be his signature stroke. He uses the [flick shot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Batting_\(cricket\)> "Batting \(cricket\)"), particularly when facing deliveries aimed towards [leg stump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Leg_stump> "Leg stump").[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-thisis2-18>) Having a limited recourse to the [sweep shot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sweep_shot> "Sweep shot"), Kohli's batting technique is characterized by an emphasis on ground shots that primarily yield runs in the regions between [deep square leg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Square_leg> "Square leg") and [mid-on](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mid_on> "Mid on").[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-255>) Kohli scores runs between [long-off](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Long_off> "Long off") and [long-on](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Long_on> "Long on") with an aligned bat. His combo of bat-speed and wrist movements enable him to craft innovative angles that disrupt traditional field positioning.[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-256>) Kohli is also an extremely proficient fielder.[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-257>)
He has a vulnerability to deliveries that are wide of the [off-stump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Off_stump> "Off stump").[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-258>) Bowlers often exploit this weakness by targeting him with such deliveries, especially in Test and ODl matches.[[256]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-259>)[[257]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-260>)[[258]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Kohli's_weakness_grows_wider-261>) Cricket experts such as [VVS Laxman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/VVS_Laxman> "VVS Laxman") and former India cricketer [Sanjay Manjrekar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sanjay_Manjrekar> "Sanjay Manjrekar") have acknowledged this weakness,[[259]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-262>)[[260]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-263>) and former New Zealand cricketer [Richard Hadlee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Richard_Hadlee> "Richard Hadlee") has also noted that Kohli is particularly susceptible to [out-swinging](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Outswinger> "Outswinger") deliveries.[[261]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-264>)
Kohli has recognition as a limited-overs batsman.[[262]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-265>)[[263]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-indiatoday.intoday.in-266>) In ODIs, he boasts an average of 65.5 runs when batting second and 51.7 runs when batting first.[[264]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-odisummary-267>) He has amassed 28 of his 51 ODI hundreds in run-chases,[[265]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-268>) and holds the record for the most hundreds scored batting second.[[266]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-269>) Kohli has often expressed a fondness for the challenge of chasing a score, relishing the opportunity to test himself and demonstrate his ability to manage strike rotation and execute boundary hits.[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-270>) His colleagues admire his self-assurance, dedication, concentration, and work ethic, which are the driving forces behind his success.[[268]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-271>)[[269]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-272>)
### Aggression
Kohli's playing style is aggressive, a trait that extends to his leadership on field.[[270]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-273>)[[271]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-274>) His captaincy is characterized as proactive, taking decisions and leading the team by example.[[272]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-275>) Kohli has been the subject of much media scrutiny and criticism in the early stages of his career. He was often portrayed as a brash and arrogant individual, eliciting mixed reactions.[[273]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-bstd-276>)[[274]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-277>) While some have praised his assertiveness and confidence,[[275]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-278>)[[276]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-279>) others have criticized Kohli's behaviour for crossing the boundaries of fair play and for losing control, sometimes resulting in a loss of composure.[[277]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-280>) The cricketer has persistently maintained that his aggression acts as a source of inspiration and drives his focus and motivation on the field.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-281>) Writing for _[The New York Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/The_New_York_Times> "The New York Times")_ , Huw Richards noted Kohli's self-assuredness and "assertiveness" in contrast to some former Indian cricketers who he felt had exhibited an inclination towards excessive politeness and reticence, and that Kohli embodies his combative demeanour both on and off the cricket field.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-282>)
## Personal life
### Marriage and kids
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg/140px-Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohali_and_Anushka_Sharma_at_Mumbai_reception.jpg>)Kohli with wife [Anushka Sharma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Anushka_Sharma> "Anushka Sharma") at their Mumbai reception
Kohli and actress [Anushka Sharma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Anushka_Sharma> "Anushka Sharma") met on the sets of an advertisement they were both signed to star in. They started dating in 2013 and their popularity led to the masses giving them the [moniker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Moniker> "Moniker") Virushka.[[280]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-283>) During an interview with [Graham Bensinger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Graham_Bensinger> "Graham Bensinger"), he recalled how they met during the promotional shoot for [Clear shampoo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Clear_\(shampoo\)> "Clear \(shampoo\)").[[281]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-284>) Their union attracted significant media and public interest.[[282]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-285>) On 11 December 2017, the couple got married in a ceremony held in [Florence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Florence> "Florence"), [Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Italy> "Italy").[[283]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-286>)
On 11 January 2021, they had their first child, a daughter.[[284]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-287>)[[285]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-288>) On 15 February 2024, the couple welcomed their second child, a son.[[286]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-289>)
### Eating habits
In 2018, Kohli disclosed that he had made the decision to adopt a [vegetarian diet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Vegetarian_cuisine> "Vegetarian cuisine") in an effort to alleviate the symptoms of a [cervical spine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Cervical_vertebrae> "Cervical vertebrae") issue caused by elevated levels of [uric acid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Uric_acid> "Uric acid"). This condition was impacting his finger movements, thus, affecting his performance as a batsman. He made a conscious effort to abstain from consuming meat, as part of his regimen for maintaining optimal health.[[287]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-290>) He has since clarified that his dietary choices do not align with a [vegan lifestyle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Veganism> "Veganism") and he continues to consume dairy products and eggs effectively making what is known in India as an [eggetarian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Eggetarian> "Eggetarian").[[288]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-291>)[[289]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-292>)[[290]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-293>) His hard work and discipline have earned him the reputation of being one of the fittest cricketers in the world.[[291]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-294>)
### Tattoos & more
Kohli has acknowledged a belief in superstitions and owns various lucky charms and rituals that he feels serve to bring him good fortune on the cricket field. One such tradition involves the donning of black [wristband](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wristband> "Wristband"). Additionally, he prefers a particular pair of gloves, which he has consistently worn.[[14]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Pratap_Sahi-2011-16>) Furthermore, Kohli has been observed sporting a [kara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kara_\(Sikhism\)> "Kara \(Sikhism\)"), a traditional bangle often worn for religious or spiritual purposes, on his right arm since 2012.[[292]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-295>) In addition to the previously mentioned superstitions, Kohli has also established the ritual of consistently donning white shoes on the cricket field.[[293]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-296>) Kohli has [tattoos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tattoo> "Tattoo") of the Hindu deity [Lord Shiva](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Shiva> "Shiva"), the sacred syllable "[Om](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Om> "Om")", the names of his parents, Prem and Saroj, a [tribal emblem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Adivasi> "Adivasi"), a representation of a serene monastery, a [samurai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Samurai> "Samurai") warrior, the astrological symbol of the [scorpion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Scorpio_\(astrology\)> "Scorpio \(astrology\)"), and his ODl and Test match cap numbers.[[294]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-297>)[[295]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-298>)
## Off the field
### Image & endorsements
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png/250px-Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_with_AudiQ7.png>)Virat Kohli with [Audi Q7](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Audi_Q7> "Audi Q7")
In 2008, Kohli was approached by [sports agent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sports_agent> "Sports agent") Bunty Sajdeh of Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment after his performance in the [ICC Under-19 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2008_Under-19_Cricket_World_Cup> "2008 Under-19 Cricket World Cup"). Sajdeh was impressed with Kohli's leadership skills and attitude and saw potential in the young cricketer. After being recommended by Yuvraj Singh, Kohli was signed to Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment.[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-jerry-299>) Over the years, Kohli's brand endorsement portfolio has experienced significant growth. In 2013, it was reported that his endorsements were valued at over ₹1 billion (US$11 million).[[297]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-300>) In 2023, his brand value reached ₹1,000 crore (US$110 million).[[298]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-301>) His bat deal with [MRF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/MRF_Limited> "MRF Limited") is one of the most financially rewarding deals in cricket history.[[299]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-302>) In 2017, Kohli entered into an endorsement agreement with [Puma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Puma_\(brand\)> "Puma \(brand\)") that spanned over eight years and was estimated to be worth around ₹1.1 billion (US$13 million). This deal made Kohli the first Indian athlete to sign a brand endorsement contract valued at ₹100 crore (equivalent to ₹140 crore or US$16 million in 2023) deal with a brand.[[300]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-303>) As of January 2023[[update]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Virat_Kohli&action=edit>), Kohli is widely regarded as the most marketable cricketer, with annual earnings estimated at ₹165 crore (equivalent to ₹175 crore or US$20 million in 2023).[[301]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-304>) Kohli is the [most followed Asian individual](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts#Most-followed_accounts> "List of most-followed Instagram accounts") on the social media platform [Instagram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Instagram> "Instagram"), with over 270 million followers on the platform. Reports indicate that he is able to command a fee of ₹8.9 crore (equivalent to ₹9.4 crore or US$1.1 million in 2023) for each sponsored post on the platform.[[302]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-305>)
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg/129px-Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum%2C_Pune.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli%27s_bat_at_Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum,_Pune.jpg>)Virat Kohli's signed bat at [Blades of Glory Cricket Museum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Blades_of_Glory_Cricket_Museum> "Blades of Glory Cricket Museum"), [Pune](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pune> "Pune")
ESPN ranked Kohli among the world's most renowned athletes.[[303]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-306>)[[304]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-ESPN's_World_Fame_100-307>) In 2014, [American Appraisal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/American_Appraisal> "American Appraisal") conducted an evaluation of Kohli's brand value and determined it to be $56.4 million, placing him fourth on the list of India's most valued celebrity brands.[[305]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-308>) In October 2016 by [Duff & Phelps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Duff_%26_Phelps> "Duff & Phelps"), Kohli's brand worth had increased to $92 million, second only to that of Bollywood actor [Shah Rukh Khan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Shah_Rukh_Khan> "Shah Rukh Khan").[[306]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-309>) In 2017, Kohli was recognized by _[Forbes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Forbes> "Forbes")_ as the seventh "Most Valuable Brand among Athletes", with a brand estimation of $14.5 million.[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-310>) By September of the same year, Kohli had endorsement agreements with 17 distinct brands, and he announced that he would only endorse products that he personally uses and believes in.[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-311>) The following year, he was featured on _[Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Time_\(magazine\)> "Time \(magazine\)")_ magazine's annual list of the [100 most influential people in the world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Time_100> "Time 100").[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-312>) In 2019, Kohli was the only cricketer included in Forbes' list of "World's 100 Highest-Paid Athletes". He was ranked 100th on the list, with earnings estimated at $25 million, with $21 million being procured through endorsements, and the remainder from salary and tournament winnings.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-313>) Furthermore, in March 2019, Kohli was named the brand ambassador of the mobile esports platform, [Mobile Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mobile_Premier_League> "Mobile Premier League").[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-314>) Kohli's earning potential continued to climb, and in 2020, he attained the 66th spot in _Forbes_ compilation of the [top 100 highest-paid athletes in the world for the year 2020](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes> "Forbes' list of the world's highest-paid athletes"), with estimated earnings exceeding $26 million.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-Hindustan_Times_2020-05-30-315>) In April 2021, [_Vivo_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Vivo_\(technology_company\)> "Vivo \(technology company\)") appointed Kohli as their brand ambassador ahead of the Indian Premier League.[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-316>)
In 2012, Kohli was recognized as one of the best-dressed men by the fashion magazine _[GQ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/GQ> "GQ")_ , appearing on their annual list.[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-317>) Six years later, in 2018, a documentary highlighting Kohli's cricketing career was released on _[National Geographic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/National_Geographic> "National Geographic")_ channel.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-318>) The following year, on the eve of the [2019 Cricket World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2019_Cricket_World_Cup> "2019 Cricket World Cup") [Madame Tussauds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Madame_Tussauds> "Madame Tussauds") unveiled an waxwork of Kohli in London.[[316]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-319>) In 2019, on the eleventh anniversary of his international debut, Kohli was honoured with a stand named after him at the [Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Feroz_Shah_Kotla_Stadium> "Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium") in Delhi, making him the youngest cricketer to receive such a recognition.[[317]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-The_Indian_Express-2019-320>) In November of the same year, an Indian animated superhero television series entitled _[Super V](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Super_V> "Super V")_ premiered, featuring a fictionalized portrayal of Kohli's teenage years and his discovery of superpowers.[[318]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-321>)
### Investments
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/Virat_Kohli_June_2016_%28cropped%29.jpg/173px-Virat_Kohli_June_2016_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_June_2016_\(cropped\).jpg>)Kohli at the opening ceremony of the [Pro Kabaddi League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pro_Kabaddi_League> "Pro Kabaddi League") in June 2016
Kohli invested in [Indian Super League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indian_Super_League> "Indian Super League") club [FC Goa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/FC_Goa> "FC Goa"), which he co-owned as of 2024. Beyond the realm of cricket, this venture served as a future business opportunity for him, as he sought to diversify his portfolio after retirement from the sport.[[319]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-322>) In 2014, Kohli partnered with Anjana Reddy's _Universal Sportsbiz_ to launch the fashion brand _WROGN_. The brand specialized in men's casual wear clothing and entered into collaborations with retail outlets such as [Myntra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Myntra> "Myntra") and [Shopper's Stop](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Shoppers_Stop> "Shoppers Stop").[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-323>) Additionally, in late 2014, Kohli became a shareholder and brand ambassador for the London-based social networking venture Sport Convo. His involvement aimed to promote and raise awareness of the platform, which was focused on providing a space for sports fans to connect and engage with one another.[[321]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-324>)
In 2015, Kohli invested a sum of ₹90 crore (US$10 million) towards the establishment of a chain of health clubs and fitness centers throughout India. Dubbed as "_Chisel_ ", the network of gyms was established through a joint venture between Kohli, Chisel India, and Cornerstone Sport and Entertainment, the organization responsible for managing Kohli's commercial pursuits.[[322]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-325>) In Sep that year, Kohli expanded his portfolio of sports-related investments by becoming a co-owner of the [International Premier Tennis League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/International_Premier_Tennis_League> "International Premier Tennis League") franchise, [UAE Royals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/UAE_Royals> "UAE Royals").[[323]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-326>) He became a co-owner of the [JSW](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/JSW_Group> "JSW Group")-owned Bengaluru Yodhas franchise in the [Pro Wrestling League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pro_Wrestling_League> "Pro Wrestling League").[[324]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-327>)
In the year 2016, Kohli joined forces with _Stepathlon Lifestyle_ to launch Stepathlon Kids. The initiative aimed to encourage young individuals to adopt healthy lifestyle habits and inculcate the love for physical activity _._[[325]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-328>)
In 2017, Kohli partnered with the German sportswear brand, [Puma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Puma_\(brand\)> "Puma \(brand\)"), to launch his athletic lifestyle brand, _One8_. This brand offers a range of sport-related apparel, footwear, and accessories.[[326]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-329>) That same year, Kohli also established Nueva, a fine dining establishment located in New Delhi. The restaurant features a South American-inspired decor accentuated with [Native American](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas> "Indigenous peoples of the Americas") artwork, providing a distinctive culinary setting.[[327]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-330>) Kohli also established _One8 Commune_ , a chain of restaurant bars. This marked his inaugural foray into the food and beverage industry. The first outlet of this restaurant was launched in 2017.[[328]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-331>)
In 2022, Kohli and his spouse made an investment of ₹2.5 crore (equivalent to ₹2.9 crore or US$340,000 in 2023) in _Digit_ , an insurance-based startup.[[329]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-332>) Additionally, they also extended their support to _Blue Tribe_ , a startup that specializes in the production and distribution of [plant-based meat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Plant-based_meat> "Plant-based meat") products. Driven by his own inclination towards a plant-based diet, Kohli aims to raise awareness and encourage individuals to adopt more sustainable and environmentally conscious practices.[[330]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-333>)
### Philanthropy
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg/250px-Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_charity.jpg>)Virat Kohli at charity dinner for Smile Foundation
In 2013, Kohli founded the "Virat Kohli Foundation" with a philanthropic objective to support underprivileged children.[[331]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-334>) The foundation collaborates with a selected group of [NGOs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Non-governmental_organization> "Non-governmental organization") to increase awareness and gather support for various causes that are instrumental in advancing their mission of promoting the welfare and well-being of these children.[[332]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-335>)[[333]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-336>) In 2014, the foundation participated in a charity auction organized by [eBay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/EBay> "EBay") and [Save the Children](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Save_the_Children> "Save the Children") India, the proceeds of which were directed towards the education and healthcare of underprivileged children.[[334]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-337>)
Kohli's foundation has organized several charity events to raise funds for its causes, including football matches featuring Indian cricketers and Bollywood actors. The first such event was a celebrity football match in collaboration with [Abhishek Bachchan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Abhishek_Bachchan> "Abhishek Bachchan")'s charity foundation, which drew media attention and was raised funds.[[335]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-338>) In this match, Kohli captained the All Hearts FC against the All Stars FC, led by Abhishek Bachchan.[[336]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-339>) Another charity football match, dubbed the "Celebrity Clasico", was held in June 2016 in Mumbai, with Kohli again leading the All Hearts FC against the All Stars FC, captained by [Ranbir Kapoor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ranbir_Kapoor> "Ranbir Kapoor").[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-340>)
In 2016, the Virat Kohli Foundation entered into a partnership with Smile Foundation to promote the empowerment of underprivileged children and young people. To kickstart this initiative, Kohli organized a philanthropic dinner at [Grand Hyatt, Mumbai](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Grand_Hyatt_Mumbai> "Grand Hyatt Mumbai"), with cricket players such as MS Dhoni, Shikhar Dhawan, Yuvraj Singh, Ajinkya Rahane, and [KL Rahul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/KL_Rahul> "KL Rahul") to support the cause of child and youth empowerment.[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-341>) To advance the goals of the [Swachh Bharat Mission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Swachh_Bharat_Mission> "Swachh Bharat Mission") (SBM), which aims at creating a cleaner India, Kohli and the Indian cricket team, in collaboration with [Anurag Thakur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Anurag_Thakur> "Anurag Thakur"), undertook a cleaning initiative at the [Eden Gardens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Eden_Gardens> "Eden Gardens") on the occasion of [Gandhi Jayanti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gandhi_Jayanti> "Gandhi Jayanti") of 2016.[[339]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-342>)
Prior to a match against Sri Lanka in the [2017 Champions Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2017_Champions_Trophy> "2017 Champions Trophy"), Kohli hosted a benevolent gala event in London in support of the Justice and Care organization. The ball was arranged with the objective of increasing both funds and awareness for the humanitarian cause championed by Justice and Care. The organization endeavors to combat human trafficking and contemporary slavery.[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-343>) In 2017, Kohli established the Athlete Development Programme (ADP) as a platform for nurturing and supporting aspiring young athletes. This initiative provides guidance to young athletes in areas such as coaching, training, fitness, competition, and nutrition. The program has been used by young sports persons, including tennis player Swastika Ghosh and golfer [Aadil Bedi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Aadil_Bedi> "Aadil Bedi").[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-344>)
In response to the [COVID-19 pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/COVID-19_pandemic> "COVID-19 pandemic") of 2020, Kohli and his wife Anushka Sharma pledged donations to the [PM CARES Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/PM_CARES_Fund> "PM CARES Fund") and the Maharashtra CM Relief Fund.[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-345>) Through his support of [Awaaz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Awaaz_Foundation> "Awaaz Foundation"), Kohli seeks to provide comprehensive medical services, shelter, and sustenance to stray animals.[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-346>)

## Performance timeline
### Test match performance
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png/960px-Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_Test_Graph.png>)An innings-by-innings breakdown of Kohli's Test batting career, showing runs scored (blue and red (not out) bars) and the black line is his career batting average.
### ODI match performance
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Virat_Kohli_ODI_Graph.png/960px-Virat_Kohli_ODI_Graph.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_ODI_Graph.png>)An innings-by-innings breakdown of Kohli's ODI batting career, showing runs scored (blue and red (not out) bars) and the black line is his career batting average.
### T20I match performance
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ab/Virat_Kohli_T20I_Graph.png/960px-Virat_Kohli_T20I_Graph.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli_T20I_Graph.png>)An innings-by-innings breakdown of Kohli's T20I batting career, showing runs scored (blue and red (not out) bars) and the black line is his career batting average.
Kohli is the only cricketer to have been named the Player of the Tournament in the T20 World Cup on two separate occasions, in [2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2014_ICC_World_Twenty20> "2014 ICC World Twenty20") and [2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2016_ICC_World_Twenty20> "2016 ICC World Twenty20").[[377]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-380>) In terms of ODI centuries, he ranks first with 51.[[378]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-381>) He surpassed Sachin Tendulkar's tally of 49 ODI tons and achieved this feat on 15 November 2023 in the semifinal of the [2023 ODI World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2023_Cricket_World_Cup> "2023 Cricket World Cup"), while also becoming the first player to score more than 700 runs in a single edition of the tournament.[[379]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-382>) Furthermore, in international cricket, Kohli has amassed 82 centuries, second only to Sachin Tendulkar's 100 centuries.[[380]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-383>) In 2018, Kohli set a record, becoming the first player to score 1,000 ODI runs in 11 innings in a calendar year.[[381]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-384>) In 2022, he achieved another milestone by scoring 1,000 runs in the [T20 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2022_Men%27s_T20_World_Cup> "2022 Men's T20 World Cup"), becoming the second player to reach this feat after Mahela Jayawardene.[[382]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-385>) During the match against Bangladesh, he became the top-scorer in the history of [T20 World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Men%27s_T20_World_Cup> "Men's T20 World Cup").[[383]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-386>)

Kohli has 82 [centuries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Century_\(cricket\)> "Century \(cricket\)") in international cricket. This includes 30 centuries including 7 double centuries in [Test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Test_cricket> "Test cricket"), 51 centuries in [ODIs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/One_Day_International> "One Day International"), and 1 century in [T20Is](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Twenty20_International> "Twenty20 International").[[384]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-387>) He has the [most ODI centuries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_One_Day_International_cricket_records#Most_centuries> "List of One Day International cricket records") and the [second most centuries in international cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_cricketers_by_number_of_international_centuries_scored#Men's_international_cricket> "List of cricketers by number of international centuries scored"), as a result.

## Notes
  1. **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_ref-2> "Jump up")** During a certain phase in his career, Kohli acquired the moniker _Cheeku_. One evening, Kohli availed himself of the services of a nearby salon and underwent a makeover. Upon displaying his new appearance to his colleagues, Kohli's assistant coach, Ajit Chowdhary, made a humorous comparison between Kohli's appearance and that of "Chikoo," a character from the popular Indian comic book, _Champak_.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-:2-1>)
  2. **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_ref-6> "Jump up")** [Punjabi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Punjabi_language> "Punjabi language"): ___Virāṭa Kohlī___ , pronounced [[ʋɪˈɾaːʈᵊˈkoːɦᵊliː]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:IPA/Punjabi> "Help:IPA/Punjabi") , [](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/e/e4/Virat_Kohli.ogg/Virat_Kohli.ogg.mp3> "Play audio")[ⓘ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Virat_Kohli.ogg> "File:Virat Kohli.ogg")
  3. **[^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_ref-57> "Jump up")** In recognition of this achievement, [Gautam Gambhir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gautam_Gambhir> "Gautam Gambhir"), who scored 150 not out in the match and received the player of the match award, graciously passed on the award to Kohli.

## From today's featured article
[![Hurricane Cindy on July 5](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg/122px-Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg> "Hurricane Cindy on July 5")
**[Hurricane Cindy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Hurricane_Cindy_\(2005\)> "Hurricane Cindy \(2005\)")** was a [tropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tropical_cyclone> "Tropical cyclone") that made [landfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Landfall> "Landfall") in the U.S. state of [Louisiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Louisiana> "Louisiana") in July 2005. The third named storm of the [2005 Atlantic hurricane season](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2005_Atlantic_hurricane_season> "2005 Atlantic hurricane season"), Cindy developed from a [tropical wave](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tropical_wave> "Tropical wave") on July 3, off the east coast of Mexico's [Yucatán Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Yucat%C3%A1n_Peninsula> "Yucatán Peninsula"). Soon after, it moved over land before emerging into the [Gulf of Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gulf_of_Mexico> "Gulf of Mexico"). It tracked toward the northern [Gulf Coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gulf_Coast_of_the_United_States> "Gulf Coast of the United States") and strengthened to reach [maximum sustained winds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Maximum_sustained_wind> "Maximum sustained wind") of 75 mph (120 km/h), making it a Category 1 on the [Saffir–Simpson scale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Saffir%E2%80%93Simpson_scale> "Saffir–Simpson scale"). The hurricane struck Louisiana, on July 5 at peak intensity, but weakened by the time it made a second landfall along southern [Mississippi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mississippi> "Mississippi"). It weakened over the southeastern US and transitioned into an [extratropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Extratropical_cyclone> "Extratropical cyclone") on July 7. The remnants of Cindy produced an outbreak of 42 tornadoes across six states before they moved into Atlantic Canada and dissipated on July 13 over the [Gulf of St. Lawrence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gulf_of_St._Lawrence> "Gulf of St. Lawrence"). Cindy caused six traffic deaths and its damage was significant. (**[Full article...](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Hurricane_Cindy_\(2005\)> "Hurricane Cindy \(2005\)")**)

## Did you know ...
[![De Lamar Mansion](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/66/Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg/250px-Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg> "De Lamar Mansion")
De Lamar Mansion
  * ... that the exterior of the **[De Lamar Mansion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Joseph_Raphael_De_Lamar_House> "Joseph Raphael De Lamar House")** _(pictured)_ was cleaned using toothbrushes during the 2000s?
  * ... that **[Edward Skeletrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Edward_Skeletrix> "Edward Skeletrix")** , to promote his album _**[Museum Music](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Museum_Music> "Museum Music")**_ , held an exhibition during which he sat inside a glass box?
  * ... that the fortified walls surrounding the Iron Age **[Tell Ruqeish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tell_Ruqeish> "Tell Ruqeish")** in Palestine are up to 5.5 metres (18 feet) thick?
  * ... that the **[Raymond C. and Mildred Kramer House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Raymond_C._and_Mildred_Kramer_House> "Raymond C. and Mildred Kramer House")** was one of fewer than half a dozen houses built in Manhattan during 1934?
  * ... that the sustainability of the **[Baggu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Baggu> "Baggu")** reusable bag is challenged by collector culture?
  * ... that NFL player **[Obe Wenig](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Obe_Wenig> "Obe Wenig")** was named an [All-Pro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/All-Pro> "All-Pro") even though he played only one game?
  * ... that director [Isao Takahata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Isao_Takahata> "Isao Takahata") reportedly stayed overnight at a [doss-house](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Flophouse> "Flophouse") to ensure that the Japanese animated film _**[Jarinko Chie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jarinko_Chie_\(film\)> "Jarinko Chie \(film\)")**_ accurately depicts the city of [Osaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Osaka> "Osaka")?
  * ... that the least populous of **[Oregon's cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_cities_in_Oregon> "List of cities in Oregon")** has three people?
  * ... that journalist **[Ivan Miller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ivan_Miller_\(journalist\)> "Ivan Miller \(journalist\)")** was once bitten by a disgruntled Santa Claus?

## Today's featured picture
[![Silene flos-cuculi](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg/500px-Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg> "Silene flos-cuculi") |  _**[Silene flos-cuculi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Silene_flos-cuculi> "Silene flos-cuculi")**_ , commonly known as the ragged robin, is a perennial herbaceous plant in the family [Caryophyllaceae](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Caryophyllaceae> "Caryophyllaceae"). Native to Europe and Asia, it is found along roads and in [wet meadows](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wet_meadow> "Wet meadow") and pastures, and has also become naturalized in parts of North America. It forms a rosette of low growing foliage with numerous stems that are 30 to 90 centimetres (12 to 36 inches) tall. The stems rise above the foliage and branch near the top of the stem, the stems having barbed hairs which point downward and make the plant rough to the touch. The middle and upper leaves are linear-lanceolate with pointed apexes. Butterflies and long-tongued bees feed on the flowers' nectar. In addition to these pollinators, the flowers are visited by many other types of insects, and can be characterized by a generalized [pollination syndrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pollination_syndrome> "Pollination syndrome"). This _S. flos-cuculi_ flower was photographed in [Niitvälja](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Niitv%C3%A4lja> "Niitvälja"), Estonia. This picture was [focus-stacked](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Focus_stacking> "Focus stacking") from 27 separate images.  Photograph credit: [Ivar Leidus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Iifar> "c:User:Iifar") Recently featured:

Explore the vast knowledge of [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia> "Wikipedia") through these helpful resources. If you have a specific topic in mind, use Wikipedia's search box. If you don't know exactly what you are looking for or wish to explore broad areas, click on a link in the header menu at the top of this page, or begin your browsing below: 
## Navigating Wikipedia's subjects
Wikipedia organizes its content into distinct subject classifications, each with further subdivisions. 
### Culture
Explore the diverse cultures, arts, beliefs, and customs of human societies. 
  * [Culture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Culture_and_the_arts> "Wikipedia:Contents/Culture and the arts")


### Geography
Discover the wonders of Earth's lands, features, inhabitants, and planetary phenomena. 
  * [Geography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Geography_and_places> "Wikipedia:Contents/Geography and places")


### Health
Learn about physical, mental, and social health. 
  * [Health](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Health_and_fitness> "Wikipedia:Contents/Health and fitness")


### History
Dive into the past through written records and scholarly exploration. 
  * [History](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/History_and_events> "Wikipedia:Contents/History and events")


#### Timelines
Explore chronological events through our comprehensive timelines. 
  * [List of timelines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_timelines> "List of timelines")


#### Current history entries
Stay up-to-date with encyclopedia entries covering ongoing events. 
  * [2025](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025> "2025") – Major events this year
  * [2025 in science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_in_science> "2025 in science") – Ongoing science findings and technology advancements
  * [Portal:Current events](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Portal:Current_events> "Portal:Current events") – Featured current events and related project activities


### Human activities
Delve into diverse human actions, from leisure and entertainment to industry and warfare. 
  * [Human activities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Human_activities> "Wikipedia:Contents/Human activities")


### Mathematics and formal sciences
Explore the study of quantity, structure, space, and change. 
  * [Mathematics and logic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Mathematics_and_logic> "Wikipedia:Contents/Mathematics and logic")


### Natural sciences
Understand natural phenomena through empirical evidence, observations, and experiments. 
  * [Natural and physical sciences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Natural_and_physical_sciences> "Wikipedia:Contents/Natural and physical sciences")


### People
Learn about collective entities, ethnic groups, and nations. 
  * [People](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/People_and_self> "Wikipedia:Contents/People and self")


### Philosophy
Dive deep into fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, values, and more. 
  * [Philosophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Philosophy_and_thinking> "Wikipedia:Contents/Philosophy and thinking")


### Reference works
Access comprehensive information collections compiled for easy retrieval. 
  * [Reference works](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Reference> "Wikipedia:Contents/Reference")

### Religion
Explore social-cultural systems, beliefs, ethics, and more. 
  * [Religion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Religion_and_belief_systems> "Wikipedia:Contents/Religion and belief systems")


### Society and social sciences
Understand collectives, social interactions, political authority, and cultural norms. 
  * [Society](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Society_and_social_sciences> "Wikipedia:Contents/Society and social sciences")


### Technology and applied sciences
Learn about techniques, skills, methods, and processes in technology and science. 
  * [Technology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Technology_and_applied_sciences> "Wikipedia:Contents/Technology and applied sciences")


## Wikipedia's main content systems
### Overview articles
Get summaries of broad topics with links to subtopics, biographies, and related articles. 
  * [Overview articles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Overviews> "Wikipedia:Contents/Overviews")


### Outline pages
Explore topics in outline format, linking to more detailed articles. 
  * [Outline pages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Outlines> "Wikipedia:Contents/Outlines")


### List pages
Find enumerations of specific types, such as lists of countries and people. 
  * [List pages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Lists> "Wikipedia:Contents/Lists")


### Portals
Access featured articles, images, news, and more through thematic portals. 
  * [Portals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Portals> "Wikipedia:Contents/Portals")


### Glossaries
Access lists of terms with definitions through alphabetical glossaries. 
  * [Glossaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Glossaries> "Wikipedia:Contents/Glossaries")


### Category system
Browse Wikipedia's category pages, which index articles by subject. 
  * [Category:Main topic classifications](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Category:Main_topic_classifications> "Category:Main topic classifications") – Arts, History, Technology, and more
  * [Wikipedia:Contents/Categories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Categories> "Wikipedia:Contents/Categories") – Hand-crafted list of topic categories
  * [Category:People](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Category:People> "Category:People") – Biographies

Riek Machar
  * **[A magnitude-7.7 earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Myanmar_earthquake> "2025 Myanmar earthquake")** leaves more than 1,000 people dead in Myanmar and Thailand.
  * The [Sudan People's Liberation Movement-in-Opposition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sudan_People%27s_Liberation_Movement-in-Opposition> "Sudan People's Liberation Movement-in-Opposition") unilaterally voids the [2018 peace agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/South_Sudanese_Civil_War#2018_peace_agreement_\(2018–2020\)> "South Sudanese Civil War") after South Sudanese vice president [Riek Machar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Riek_Machar> "Riek Machar") _(pictured)_ and interior minister [Angelina Teny](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Angelina_Teny> "Angelina Teny") **[are detained](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Riek_Machar#2025_arrest> "Riek Machar")**.
  * The [Sudanese Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sudanese_Armed_Forces> "Sudanese Armed Forces") **[recapture Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Battle_of_Khartoum_\(2023%E2%80%932025\)> "Battle of Khartoum \(2023–2025\)")** from the [Rapid Support Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces> "Rapid Support Forces") after almost two years of fighting.

**Disasters and accidents**
  * [2025 Myanmar earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Myanmar_earthquake> "2025 Myanmar earthquake")
    * [2025 Bangkok skyscraper collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Bangkok_skyscraper_collapse> "2025 Bangkok skyscraper collapse")
      * An under-construction government office [skyscraper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Skyscraper> "Skyscraper") collapses in Bangkok, Thailand, killing at least six people and leaving more than 101 others missing and trapped under the rubble. [(CTV News)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.ctvnews.ca/world/article/powerful-earthquakes-rock-thailand-and-myanmar-triggering-the-collapse-of-a-bangkok-high-rise/>)
    * A 7.7 [magnitude](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Richter_scale#Richter_magnitudes> "Richter scale") [earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Earthquake> "Earthquake") strikes [Sagaing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Sagaing> "Sagaing"), [Myanmar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Myanmar> "Myanmar"), with significant damages reported as far away as [Bangkok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Bangkok> "Bangkok"), [Thailand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Thailand> "Thailand"). Over 1,000 people are killed in Myanmar and ten more in Thailand. A [state of emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/State_of_emergency> "State of emergency") is declared by the [Myanmar government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/State_Administration_Council> "State Administration Council"). [(CNN Live)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.cnn.com/world/live-news/myanmar-thailand-earthquake-03-29-25-intl-hnk/index.html>) [(NBC News)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.nbcnews.com/news/world/earthquake-myanmar-thailand-77-bangkok-tremor-rcna198515>)
    * The [Ava Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ava_Bridge> "Ava Bridge") in [Mandalay Region](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mandalay_Region> "Mandalay Region"), Myanmar, partially [collapses as a result of the earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_populated_places_affected_by_the_2025_Myanmar_earthquake#Structures_and_infrastructure> "List of populated places affected by the 2025 Myanmar earthquake"). [(News18)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.news18.com/world/myanmar-earthquake-videos-bangkok-skyscraper-collapses-tremors-strong-earthquakes-hit-myanmar-9278285.html>)
  * Russian authorities claim that yesterday's sinking of the _Sindbad_ [submarine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Submarine> "Submarine") in [Hurghada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Hurghada> "Hurghada"), [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Egypt> "Egypt"), killing six Russians, happened during boarding and not due to a collision as reported. [(_The National_)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.thenationalnews.com/news/mena/2025/03/28/hurghada-submarine-allegedly-began-sinking-while-passengers-boarding-claim-russian-authorities/>)

**Business and economy**
  * [Tariffs in the second Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tariffs_in_the_second_Trump_administration> "Tariffs in the second Trump administration")
    * [2025 United States trade war with Canada and Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_United_States_trade_war_with_Canada_and_Mexico> "2025 United States trade war with Canada and Mexico")
      * [Canadian Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada> "Prime Minister of Canada") [Mark Carney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mark_Carney> "Mark Carney") says a 25% [tariff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tariff> "Tariff") on [automotive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Automotive_industry> "Automotive industry") imports to the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/United_States> "United States") is a "direct attack" on his country by the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Second_presidency_of_Donald_Trump> "Second presidency of Donald Trump") and vows to respond. [(AP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/apnews.com/article/canada-carney-trump-trade-war-a1ed1bb3bb9d69cc4d88eaeabe3ac16b>)
    * [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Japan> "Japan") confirms it has asked the U.S. for an exemption from the new automotive tariffs, saying the 25% tariff on vehicle imports would have a massive negative impact on [its automotive industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Automotive_industry_in_Japan> "Automotive industry in Japan"). Japan is one of the largest exporters of cars to the United States. [(Kyodo News)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/english.kyodonews.net/news/2025/03/5d5b549dc5ca-update1-japan-vows-appropriate-steps-against-us-auto-tariffs.html>)

**Disasters and accidents**

    * Ongoing [climate-exacerbated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Climate_change> "Climate change") [wildfires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wildfire> "Wildfire") in [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/South_Korea> "South Korea") develop into the worst natural fire disaster in the nation's history after doubling in size over the course of 24 hours, killing at least 26 people and destroying much of the [ancient](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Silla> "Silla") [Gounsa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Gounsa> "Gounsa") [temple](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Buddhist_temples_in_Korea> "Buddhist temples in Korea") site.   * [Insurgency in Balochistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Insurgency_in_Balochistan> "Insurgency in Balochistan")
    * Eight people, including at least four [police officers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Balochistan_Police> "Balochistan Police"), are killed in two separate [mass shootings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mass_shooting> "Mass shooting") in [Nushki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Nushki> "Nushki") and [Kalat District](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kalat_District> "Kalat District"), [Balochistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Balochistan> "Balochistan"), [Pakistan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Pakistan> "Pakistan"). [(Report.az)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/report.az/diger-olkeler/pakistanin-iki-hucum-zamani-8-nefer-oldurulub/>)
  * [Red Sea crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Red_Sea_crisis> "Red Sea crisis")
    * The [Israel Defense Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces> "Israel Defense Forces") report that they intercepted a [ballistic missile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ballistic_missile> "Ballistic missile") launched by the [Houthis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Houthis> "Houthis") from [Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Yemen> "Yemen"), which triggered [sirens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Civil_defense_siren> "Civil defense siren") across [central Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Central_District_\(Israel\)> "Central District \(Israel\)"). [(_Times of Israel_)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.timesofisrael.com/houthis-fire-ballistic-missile-at-israel-triggering-sirens-across-center-of-country/>)
  * [Russian invasion of Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine> "Russian invasion of Ukraine")
    * Seven people are killed and dozens are injured across [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ukraine> "Ukraine") by overnight [Russian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Russia> "Russia") [drone strikes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Drone_warfare> "Drone warfare"), including three [civilians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Civilian> "Civilian") killed in [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Kyiv> "Kyiv"). [(CTV News)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.ctvnews.ca/world/russia-ukraine-war/article/7-killed-after-moscow-targets-ukraine-with-a-mass-drone-attack-ahead-of-ceasefire-talks/>)
    * [Ukrainian troops](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Ukrainian_Ground_Forces> "Ukrainian Ground Forces") reportedly recapture the village of [Nadiia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Nadiia,_Luhansk_Oblast> "Nadiia, Luhansk Oblast"), [Luhansk Oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Luhansk_Oblast> "Luhansk Oblast"). [(_Kyiv Post_)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.kyivpost.com/post/49428>)


**Disasters and accidents**
  * A van crashes into a ravine and catches fire in [Nuevo León](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Nuevo_Le%C3%B3n> "Nuevo León"), [Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mexico> "Mexico"), killing twelve people and injuring four others. The vehicle fire also sparked a small [wildfire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wildfire> "Wildfire") in the surrounding forest. [(Reuters)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.reuters.com/world/americas/northern-mexico-van-accident-kills-12-people-sparks-forest-fire-2025-03-24/>)


**International relations**
  * [Middle Eastern crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_\(2023%E2%80%93present\)> "Middle Eastern crisis \(2023–present\)")
    * U.S. National Security Advisor [Mike Waltz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mike_Waltz> "Mike Waltz") says that the [U.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/U.S.> "U.S.") wants the "full dismantlement" of [Iran](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Iran> "Iran")'s [nuclear program](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Nuclear_program_of_Iran> "Nuclear program of Iran") and that "all options are on the table". [(Al Arabiya)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2025/03/23/trump-advisor-says-us-seeking-full-dismantlement-of-iran-s-nuclear-program>) [(Reuters)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.reuters.com/world/trumps-offer-talks-with-iran-aims-avoid-military-action-us-envoy-says-2025-03-23/>)


**Law and crime**
  * [2025 Turkish protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Turkish_protests> "2025 Turkish protests"), [Censorship in Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Censorship_in_Turkey> "Censorship in Turkey")
    * A statement by [social media company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Social_media> "Social media") [X](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Twitter> "Twitter") expresses that it objects to "multiple [court orders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Court_order> "Court order")" from the [government of Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Government_of_Turkey> "Government of Turkey") to block more than 700 accounts belonging to opposition political figures, [journalists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mass_media_in_Turkey> "Mass media in Turkey"), [news outlets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_newspapers_in_Turkey> "List of newspapers in Turkey"), and student protesters. [(BBC News)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.bbc.com/news/live/cq6yde479gdt>)


**Politics and elections**
  * [2025 Turkish protests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Turkish_protests> "2025 Turkish protests")
    * Several hundred thousands of anti-[Erdoğan government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Recep_Tayyip_Erdo%C4%9Fan> "Recep Tayyip Erdoğan") protesters demonstrate outside of [Istanbul City Hall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Municipal_Council_of_Istanbul> "Municipal Council of Istanbul"), with the nationwide protests becoming the largest [Turkish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Turkey> "Turkey") [political demonstration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Political_demonstration> "Political demonstration") movement in over a decade. [(AP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/apnews.com/article/turkey-mayor-jailed-istanbul-f962743f724f00a318f84ffaed7f58de>)

      * In [tennis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Tennis> "Tennis"), [Alexandra Eala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Alexandra_Eala> "Alexandra Eala") becomes the first [Filipino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Philippines> "Philippines") player to defeat a top-10 opponent since the [WTA rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/WTA_rankings> "WTA rankings") began in 1975, after winning in the third round of the [Women's singles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2025_Miami_Open_%E2%80%93_Women%27s_singles> "2025 Miami Open – Women's singles") tournament at the [Miami Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Miami_Open_\(tennis\)> "Miami Open \(tennis\)") against world No. 5 [Madison Keys](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Madison_Keys> "Madison Keys"). _The Last of the Greats_  
---  
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/c/c2/TheLastoftheGreats.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:TheLastoftheGreats.jpg>) cover to issue #1  
Publication information  
[Publisher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/List_of_comics_publishing_companies> "List of comics publishing companies")| [Image Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Image_Comics> "Image Comics")  
Schedule| Monthly  
Publication date| October2011 – February2012  
No. of issues| 5  
Main character(s)| Last  
Creative team  
Written by| [Joshua Hale Fialkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Joshua_Hale_Fialkov> "Joshua Hale Fialkov")  
Artist(s)| [Brent Peeples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</w/index.php?title=Brent_Peeples&action=edit&redlink=1> "Brent Peeples \(page does not exist\)")  
[Colorist(s)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Colorist> "Colorist")| [Mirka Andolfo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Mirka_Andolfo> "Mirka Andolfo")  
_**The Last of the Greats**_ is a comic book [limited series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Limited_series_\(comics\)> "Limited series \(comics\)") created by writer [Joshua Hale Fialkov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Joshua_Hale_Fialkov> "Joshua Hale Fialkov") and the artist [Brent Peeples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</w/index.php?title=Brent_Peeples&action=edit&redlink=1> "Brent Peeples \(page does not exist\)"). It was published by [Image Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Image_Comics> "Image Comics") from October 5, [2011](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2011_in_comics> "2011 in comics"), to February [2012](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/2012_in_comics> "2012 in comics"). A sequel, _Return of the Greats_ , is forthcoming.[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-1>)
## Story
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</w/index.php?title=The_Last_of_the_Greats&action=edit&section=1> "Edit section: Story")]
It takes place in a world where seven alien super powered beings known as the _Greats_ have eliminated disease, poverty and social inequality. At the start of the story, humanity found a way to kill all of the Greats save one, who kept himself hidden,[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-2>) never bothering to try to help Earth as his siblings did. Now humanity must plead with the last of the Greats to stop an alien invasion that threatens the entire world.[[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-3>)
There are several startling revelations during the first five issues. It is revealed that though the Greats seemingly died, they are beings of energy and therefore have been absorbed by their remaining brother, who is now extorting the human race into complete subjugation for his help. When the Last Great seeks to engage the alien ships, he actually goes aboard one of them and seems to be in charge of the fleet, which he then orders to destroy two-thirds of the Earth's population. In flashbacks, it is seen that the Last Great's sister had a child with her adviser and the child has abilities like the other Greats, but she is being kept hidden from the Last Great for her own protection. 
Later in the story, the Last Great is attacked by his "niece", and during the battle, the reader is given a glimpse of the other Greats in a big field under a tree that represents them being part of the Last Great's subconscious, mingling and talking with each other. Due to the Last Great's niece fighting with him, the internal struggle with the other Greats causes them to attempt to release themselves from his body. All of the Greats do this, except for one woman. The Last Great and this woman have plotted to have the others release themselves and float around as formless energy so that they can enact a master plan that they have been planning for some time. 
## Collected editions
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</w/index.php?title=The_Last_of_the_Greats&action=edit&section=2> "Edit section: Collected editions")]
The first series was collected into a [trade paperback](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Trade_paperback_\(comics\)> "Trade paperback \(comics\)"): 
  * _Volume 1_ (collects _Last of the Greats_ #1–5, Image Comics, paperback, March 2012, [ISBN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/ISBN_\(identifier\)> "ISBN \(identifier\)") [978-1-60706-518-0](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-60706-518-0> "Special:BookSources/978-1-60706-518-0"))


## Reception
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</w/index.php?title=The_Last_of_the_Greats&action=edit&section=3> "Edit section: Reception")]
Jamil Scalese of _[Comics Bulletin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Comics_Bulletin> "Comics Bulletin")_ called the story "page-turning, jaw-dropping" and wrote, "The Last of the Greats sets itself up to be one [of] the best mindfuck comics to hit shelves recently." He praised the artwork as well.[[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-4>) _[IGN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/IGN> "IGN")_ felt the series had a "neat concept" but complained about the lack of character development in the first issue.[[5]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#cite_note-5>)
