This is a [general introduction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:INFOPAGES> "Wikipedia:INFOPAGES") for visitors to Wikipedia. For aspiring contributors, also see this [guide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contributing_to_Wikipedia> "Wikipedia:Contributing to Wikipedia") and [tutorial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction> "Help:Introduction"). For other uses, see [Wikipedia:Wikipedia (disambiguation)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Wikipedia_\(disambiguation\)> "Wikipedia:Wikipedia \(disambiguation\)").
"Imagine a world in which every single person on the planet is given free access to the sum of all human knowledge. That's what we're doing." —[Jimmy Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jimmy_Wales> "Jimmy Wales")
**[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia> "Wikipedia")** is a [free online encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Free_encyclopedia> "Wikipedia:Free encyclopedia") that anyone can edit, and [millions already have](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:RecentChanges> "Special:RecentChanges"). 
[Wikipedia's purpose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Purpose> "Wikipedia:Purpose") is to benefit readers by presenting information on all branches of [knowledge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Knowledge> "Knowledge"). Hosted by the [Wikimedia Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Wikimedia_Foundation> "Wikipedia:Wikimedia Foundation"), Wikipedia consists of [freely editable](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Editing> "Help:Editing") content, with articles that usually contain numerous links guiding readers to more information. 
[Written collaboratively](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Collaborative_writing> "Collaborative writing") by volunteers known as [Wikipedians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia_community> "Wikipedia community"), Wikipedia articles can be edited by anyone with [Internet access](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Internet_access> "Internet access"), except in [limited cases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy> "Wikipedia:Protection policy") in which [editing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Editing> "Editing") is restricted to prevent [disruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Disruption> "Wikipedia:Disruption") or [vandalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:VAND> "Wikipedia:VAND"). Since its creation on [January 15, 2001](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia_Day> "Wikipedia Day"), it has grown into the world's [largest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Size_of_Wikipedia> "Wikipedia:Size of Wikipedia") reference [website](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Website> "Website"), attracting [over a billion visitors each month](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/stats.wikimedia.org/#/all-wikipedia-projects/reading/unique-devices> "stats:"). Wikipedia currently has more than [sixty-four million articles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/List_of_Wikipedias#All_Wikipedias_ordered_by_number_of_articles> "m:List of Wikipedias") in [more than 300 languages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:SiteMatrix> "Special:SiteMatrix"), including 6,974,023 articles in [English](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/English_language> "English language"), with 125,074 active contributors in the past month. 
Wikipedia's fundamental principles are summarized in its [five pillars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Five_pillars> "Wikipedia:Five pillars"). While the [Wikipedia community](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia_community> "Wikipedia community") has developed many [policies and guidelines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Policies_and_guidelines> "Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines"), new editors do not need to be familiar with them before they start contributing. 
[Anyone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Who_writes_Wikipedia%3F> "Wikipedia:Who writes Wikipedia?") can [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Editing> "Help:Editing") Wikipedia's text, data, references, and images. The quality of content is more important than the expertise of who contributes it. Wikipedia's content must conform with its [policies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Editing_policy> "Wikipedia:Editing policy"), including being [verifiable](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiable> "Wikipedia:Verifiable") by published [reliable sources](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources> "Wikipedia:Reliable sources"). Contributions based on [personal opinions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Neutral_point_of_view> "Wikipedia:Neutral point of view"), beliefs, or personal experiences, [unreviewed research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Original_research> "Wikipedia:Original research"), libellous material, and [copyright violations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Copyright_violations> "Wikipedia:Copyright violations") are not allowed, and will not remain. Wikipedia's software makes it easy to reverse errors, and experienced [editors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia_editor> "Wikipedia editor") [watch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Watchlist> "Wikipedia:Watchlist") and [patrol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Recent_changes_patrol> "Wikipedia:Recent changes patrol") bad edits. 
[Wikipedia differs from printed references in important ways](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NOTPAPER> "Wikipedia:NOTPAPER"). Anyone can instantly improve it, add quality information, remove misinformation, and fix errors and [vandalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Vandalism> "Wikipedia:Vandalism"). Since Wikipedia is continually updated, encyclopedic articles on major news events appear within minutes. 
For over 24 years, editors have volunteered their time and talents to create history's most comprehensive encyclopedia while providing references and other resources to researchers worldwide (see [Researching with Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Researching_with_Wikipedia> "Wikipedia:Researching with Wikipedia")). In summary, Wikipedia has tested the [wisdom of the crowd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wisdom_of_the_crowd> "Wisdom of the crowd") since 2001 and has found that it succeeds. 
> To start editing simply click the `Edit` or `Edit source`button, or the pencil icon[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Pencil_edit_icon.svg/22px-Pencil_edit_icon.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Pencil_edit_icon.svg>), at the top of any [non-protected](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy> "Wikipedia:Protection policy") Wikipedia page or section.

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Introduction
[Readers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us/Readers> "Wikipedia:Contact us/Readers") How to report a problem with an article, or find out more information. 
[Article subjects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us/Article_subjects> "Wikipedia:Contact us/Article subjects") Problems with articles about you, your company, or somebody you represent. 
[Licensing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us/Licensing> "Wikipedia:Contact us/Licensing") How to copy Wikipedia's information, donate your own, or report unlicensed use of your information. 
[Donors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us/Donors> "Wikipedia:Contact us/Donors") Find out about the process, how to donate, and information about how your money is spent. 
[Press and partnerships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us/Press_and_partnerships> "Wikipedia:Contact us/Press and partnerships") If you're a member of the press looking to contact Wikipedia, or have a business proposal for us. 
[Back to main page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Main> "Wikipedia:Main")
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Contactus-wmcolors.svg/220px-Contactus-wmcolors.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Contactus-wmcolors.svg>)
Thank you for your interest in contacting Wikipedia. Before proceeding, some important disclaimers: 
  1. **Wikipedia has no central editorial board.** Contributions are made by a large number of volunteers at their own discretion. Edits are neither the responsibility of the [Wikimedia Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/foundation.wikimedia.org/wiki/Home> "wmf:Home") (the organisation that hosts the site) nor of its staff and edits will not generally be made in response to an email request.
  2. Although Wikipedia was founded by [Jimmy Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Jimmy_Wales> "Jimmy Wales"), he is not personally responsible for our content.
  3. If you have questions about the _concept_ of Wikipedia rather than a specific problem, the [About Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:About> "Wikipedia:About") page may help.
  4. If you want to ask other users for help with editing or using Wikipedia, stop by the [Teahouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Teahouse> "Wikipedia:Teahouse"), Wikipedia's [live help channel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:IRC_help_disclaimer> "Wikipedia:IRC help disclaimer"), or the [help desk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Help_desk> "Wikipedia:Help desk") to ask someone for assistance.
  5. If you disagree with an article's content, or are involved in a content dispute, see [Dispute resolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Dispute_resolution> "Wikipedia:Dispute resolution").


The links on the left should direct you to how to contact us or resolve problems. If you cannot find your issue listed there, you can email helpful, experienced volunteers at info-en![@](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/At_sign.svg/20px-At_sign.svg.png)wikimedia.org. Please refrain from emailing about disagreements with content; they will not be resolved via email.

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Main page of the help namespace
This page provides **help with the most common questions about[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia> "Wikipedia")**. 
You can also search Wikipedia's help pages using the search box below, or browse the **[Help menu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Menu> "Help:Menu")** or the **[Help directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Directory> "Help:Directory")**. 
Help Wikipedia
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c4/OOjs_UI_icon_article-ltr.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_article-ltr.svg.png)
## **Read** or **find** an article
The **[Readers' FAQ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:FAQ/Readers> "Wikipedia:FAQ/Readers")** and our **[about page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:About> "Wikipedia:About")** contain the most commonly sought information about Wikipedia. 
For simple searches, there is a search bar at the top of every page. Type what you are looking for in the box. Suggested matches will appear in a dropdown list. Select any page in the list to go to that page. Or, select the "Search" button, or press `↵ Enter`, to go to a full search result. For advanced searches, see **[Help:Searching](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Searching> "Help:Searching")**. 
There are other ways to browse and explore Wikipedia articles; many can be found at **[Wikipedia:Contents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents> "Wikipedia:Contents")**. See our **[disclaimer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:General_disclaimer> "Wikipedia:General disclaimer")** for cautions about Wikipedia's limitations. 
For **[mobile access](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Mobile_access> "Help:Mobile access")** , press the [**mobile view**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Contents>) link at the very bottom of every [**desktop view**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Contents>) page. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr.svg.png)
## **Edit** an article
Contributing is easy: see **[how to edit a page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Editing> "Help:Editing")**. For a quick summary on participating, see **[contributing to Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contributing_to_Wikipedia> "Wikipedia:Contributing to Wikipedia")** , and for a friendly tutorial, see **[our introduction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction> "Help:Introduction")**. For a listing of introductions and tutorials by topic, see **[getting started](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Getting_started> "Help:Getting started")**. The **[Simplified Manual of Style](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:SMOS> "Wikipedia:SMOS")** and **[Cheatsheet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Cheatsheet> "Help:Cheatsheet")** can remind you of basic [wiki markup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Wikitext> "Help:Wikitext"). 
**[Be bold](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Be_bold> "Wikipedia:Be bold")** in improving articles! When adding facts, please **[provide references](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing/1> "Help:Introduction to referencing/1")** so others may verify them. If you are affiliated with the article subject, please see our **[conflict of interest guideline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Conflict_of_interest> "Wikipedia:Conflict of interest")**. 
The **[simple guide to vandalism cleanup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Simple_guide_to_vandalism_cleanup> "Help:Simple guide to vandalism cleanup")** can help you undo malicious edits. 
If you're looking for places you can help out, the **[Task Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Task_Center> "Wikipedia:Task Center")** is the place to go, or check out what else is happening at the **[community portal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Community_portal> "Wikipedia:Community portal")**. You can practice editing and experiment in a **[sandbox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Sandbox> "Wikipedia:Sandbox")** your **[sandbox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:MyPage/sandbox> "Special:MyPage/sandbox")**. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/OOjs_UI_icon_bell.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_bell.svg.png)
## **Report a problem** with an article
If there is a problem with an article about yourself, a family member, a friend or a colleague, please read **[Biographies of living persons/Help](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons/Help> "Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons/Help")**. 
If you spot a problem with an article, you can fix it directly, by clicking on the "Edit" link at the top of that page. **[See the "edit an article" section of this page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#edit-heading>)** for more information. 
If you don't feel ready to fix the article yourself, post a message on the article's **[talk page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Talk_page_guidelines> "Wikipedia:Talk page guidelines")**. This will bring the matter to the attention of others who work on that article. There is a "Talk" link at the beginning of _every_ article page. 
You can **[contact us](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us_-_Readers> "Wikipedia:Contact us - Readers")**. If it's an article about you or your organization, see **[Contact us – Subjects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us_-_Subjects> "Wikipedia:Contact us - Subjects")**. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/OOjs_UI_icon_add.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_add.svg.png)
## **Create a new article** or **upload media**
Check **[Your first article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Your_first_article> "Wikipedia:Your first article")** to see if your topic is appropriate, then the **[Article wizard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Article_wizard> "Wikipedia:Article wizard")** will walk you through creating the article. 
Once you have created an article, see **[Writing better articles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Writing_better_articles> "Wikipedia:Writing better articles")** for guidance on how to improve it and what to include (like reference **[citations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources> "Wikipedia:Citing sources")**). 
For contributing images, audio or video files, see the **[Introduction to uploading images](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_uploading_images/1> "Help:Introduction to uploading images/1")**. Then the **[Upload wizard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:File_Upload_Wizard> "Wikipedia:File Upload Wizard")** will guide you through that process. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/69/OOjs_UI_icon_help.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_help.svg.png)
## **Stuck?**
Answers to common problems can be found at **[frequently asked questions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:FAQ> "Wikipedia:FAQ")**. 
Or check out **[where to ask questions or make comments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Questions> "Wikipedia:Questions")**. 
New users should seek help at the **[Teahouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Teahouse> "Wikipedia:Teahouse")** if they're having problems while editing Wikipedia. 
More complex questions can be posed at the **[Help desk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Help_desk> "Wikipedia:Help desk")**. Volunteers will respond as soon as they're able. 
Or [**ask for help on your talk page**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:MyTalk&action=edit&section=new&preload=Help:Contents/helpmepreload&preloadtitle=Help+me%21>) and a volunteer will visit you there! 
You can get live help with editing in the **[help chatroom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:IRC_help_disclaimer> "Wikipedia:IRC help disclaimer")**. 
For help with technical issues, ask at the **[Village pump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump_\(technical\)> "Wikipedia:Village pump \(technical\)")**. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/OOjs_UI_icon_references-ltr.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_references-ltr.svg.png)
## **Factual questions**
If **[searching Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:Search> "Special:Search")** has not answered your question (_for example, questions like "Which country has the world's largest fishing fleet?"_), try the **[Reference Desk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Reference_desk> "Wikipedia:Reference desk")**. Volunteers there will attempt to answer your questions on any topic, or point you toward the information you need. 
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/OOjs_UI_icon_listBullet-ltr.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_listBullet-ltr.svg.png)
## **Directories**
  * **[Directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Directory> "Wikipedia:Directory")**: main list of directories and indexes.


### Help related
  * **[Help directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Directory> "Help:Directory")** : for informative, instructional and consultation pages.
  * **[Request directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Request_directory> "Wikipedia:Request directory")** : for services and assistance that can be requested on Wikipedia.


### Protocols and conventions
  * **[Policy directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:List_of_policies> "Wikipedia:List of policies")** : official policies for "English Wikipedia".
  * **[Guideline directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:List_of_guidelines> "Wikipedia:List of guidelines")** : official guidelines for "English Wikipedia".
  * **[Manual of Style directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Contents> "Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Contents")** : pages related to the style manual of Wikipedia articles.


### Community related
  * **[Departments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Department_directory> "Wikipedia:Department directory")** : for the different divisions of Wikipedia.
  * **[Editor's index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Editor%27s_index_to_Wikipedia> "Wikipedia:Editor's index to Wikipedia")** : for everything an editor needs to know to work on Wikipedia.
  * **[Essay directory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Essay_directory> "Wikipedia:Essay directory")** : for Wikipedia namespace essays.
  * **[Dashboard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Dashboard> "Wikipedia:Dashboard")** : for current discussions taking place throughout Wikipedia.
  * **[WikiProjects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Council/Directory> "Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Directory")** : for people who want to work together as a team to improve Wikipedia.


###  MediaWiki software
  * **[Wikitext](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Wikitext> "Help:Wikitext")** : for the syntax used by Wikipedia to format a page.
  * **[HTML](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:HTML_in_wikitext> "Help:HTML in wikitext")** : for HTML5 elements, or tags and their attribute.
  * **[Templates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Template_index> "Wikipedia:Template index")** : for templates used within Wikipedia.

## **Tip** of the day
**Work faster with keyboard shortcuts**
Wikipedia has keystroke combinations that can speed up your work, like `⇧ Shift`+`Alt`+`F` to "focus" on (jump to) the search box, `⇧ Shift`+`Alt`+`M` to move the current page and its talk page, `⇧ Shift`+`Alt`+`T` to open the current article's talk page, `⇧ Shift`+`Alt`+`Y` to open a list of your user's contributions, and many more. Those are for Windows users. On the Mac OS, press `Control` instead of `⇧ Shift`+`Alt`. For some browsers, the accesskey is the `Alt` key instead. For details see **[Keyboard shortcuts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Keyboard_shortcuts> "Wikipedia:Keyboard shortcuts")**. 
[Prior tip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day/March_26> "Wikipedia:Tip of the day/March 26") – [Tips library](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tips> "Wikipedia:Tips") – [Next tip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day/March_28> "Wikipedia:Tip of the day/March 28")
_[Become a Wikipedia tipster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Wikipedia_tipster> "Wikipedia:Wikipedia tipster")_ – [Tips library, by subject](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tips> "Wikipedia:Tips")
To add this auto-updating daily tip to your user page, use **{{[totd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Totd> "Template:Totd")}}**

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Tutorial for new editors
Introduction to Wikipedia
**[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia> "Wikipedia") is made by [people like **you**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:RecentChanges> "Special:RecentChanges").**
This page takes you through a set of tutorials aimed at _complete newcomers_ interested in contributing. It covers all the basics, and each tutorial takes only a few minutes, so you can become a proficient [Wikipedian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Wikipedians> "Wikipedia:Wikipedians") in no time!
[Get started](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_Wikipedia> "Help:Introduction to Wikipedia") [Policies and Guidelines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_policies_and_guidelines/1> "Help:Introduction to policies and guidelines/1")
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bb/Source_editor_logo.svg/160px-Source_editor_logo.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_editing_with_Wiki_Markup/1> "Help:Introduction to editing with Wiki Markup/1") The **[wiki markup source editor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Wikitext> "Help:Wikitext")** shows the underlying page source code. It works like a plain text file, indicating links and other items using simple code like this: `[[Earth]]`. 
[Editing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_editing_with_Wiki_Markup/1> "Help:Introduction to editing with Wiki Markup/1") [Referencing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1> "Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1") [Images](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_images_with_Wiki_Markup/1> "Help:Introduction to images with Wiki Markup/1") [Tables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_tables_with_Wiki_Markup/1> "Help:Introduction to tables with Wiki Markup/1")
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/12/VisualEditor-logo.svg/160px-VisualEditor-logo.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_editing_with_VisualEditor/1> "Help:Introduction to editing with VisualEditor/1") **[VisualEditor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:VisualEditor> "Help:VisualEditor")** is the easier way of editing that works more like a word processor and hides the underlying source code. Links and other items are edited using toolbar and pop-up interfaces. 
[Editing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_editing_with_VisualEditor/1> "Help:Introduction to editing with VisualEditor/1") [Referencing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_VisualEditor/1> "Help:Introduction to referencing with VisualEditor/1") [Images](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_images_with_VisualEditor/1> "Help:Introduction to images with VisualEditor/1") [Tables](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_tables_with_VisualEditor/1> "Help:Introduction to tables with VisualEditor/1")
[Talk pages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_talk_pages/1> "Help:Introduction to talk pages/1") [Navigating Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_navigating_Wikipedia/1> "Help:Introduction to navigating Wikipedia/1")[Manual of Style](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_the_Manual_of_Style> "Help:Introduction to the Manual of Style")[Conclusion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction/Conclusion> "Help:Introduction/Conclusion")
[View all as single page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Introduction/All> "Help:Introduction/All")

##  Community bulletin board 
This section is [transcluded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Transclusion> "Help:Transclusion") from [Wikipedia:Community bulletin board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board> "Wikipedia:Community bulletin board"). ([edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board&action=edit>) | [history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board&action=history>))
show[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Ambox_notice.png/16px-Ambox_notice.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Ambox_notice.png>) How to add to the community bulletin board  
---  
| ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/1d/Information_icon4.svg/40px-Information_icon4.svg.png)| The community bulletin board has 2 sections that can be used by Wikipedians for announcements: "Events and projects" and "WikiProject notices". In general, keep it **concise** (under 2 lines), refrain from **fancy formatting** , and new entries should be placed at the **top** of their section. 
  * Before editing, make sure you are on [Wikipedia:Community bulletin board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board> "Wikipedia:Community bulletin board"), not Wikipedia:Community portal, where the board is transcluded.
  * **Events and projects** : In this section, only organized events, projects, and/or competitions should be listed. These are organized by how often they occur: 
    * The **Yearly** section is for uncommon events, like events that only occur every year, once, or irregularly. The **Monthly** section is for events that occur each month, or are always ongoing.
  * **WikiProject notices** : In this section, any announcement, request for help or other notice from a WikiProject should be listed here. 
    * Entries should be signed, and ordered from newest to oldest.
    * Entries are to be removed after a period of **6 months**.

  
---|---

Events and projects [[add]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:EditPage/Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board> "Special:EditPage/Wikipedia:Community bulletin board")
**Yearly or infrequent events**
  * **[Wikidata and Sister Projects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.wikidata.org/wiki/Event:Wikidata_and_Sister_Projects> "d:Event:Wikidata and Sister Projects")**. May 29 - June 1, an online event exploring the different ways Wikidata is connected and used in the other Wikimedia projects, including Wikipedia. We are currently accepting session proposals for the event program, you can [submit them here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.wikidata.org/wiki/Event_talk:Wikidata_and_Sister_Projects> "d:Event talk:Wikidata and Sister Projects"), or ask any questions you may have!


**Monthly or continuous events**
  * **[Monthly contest, WikiProject Military history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Military_history/Contest> "Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Contest").** The contest department of the Military history WikiProject aims to motivate increased quality in military history articles by offering a form of friendly competition for project members making improvements to them. The primary contest available is a simple rolling competition that awards points for improving articles. The contest runs from the first to last day of each month.
  * **Guild of Copy Editors' editing drive.** The **[March 2025 backlog drive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Guild_of_Copy_Editors/Backlog_elimination_drives/March_2025> "Wikipedia:WikiProject Guild of Copy Editors/Backlog elimination drives/March 2025")** is a one-month-long effort by the [**Guild of Copy Editors**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Guild_of_Copy_Editors> "Wikipedia:WikiProject Guild of Copy Editors") to reduce the backlog of articles that require copy editing: those carrying the {{[copy edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Copy_edit> "Template:Copy edit")}} tag (also {{[awkward](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Awkward> "Template:Awkward")}}, {{[copy edit section](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Copy_edit_section> "Template:Copy edit section")}}, {{[inappropriate person](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Inappropriate_person> "Template:Inappropriate person")}}, and {{[copy edit inline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Copy_edit_inline> "Template:Copy edit inline")}}, and their redirects) or are listed on the [GOCE Requests page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:GOCE/REQ> "Wikipedia:GOCE/REQ"). _It began on 1 March, 00:00 (UTC), and will end on 31 March, 23:59 (UTC)._
  * **[Wikipedia:WikiProject Women in Red](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Women_in_Red> "Wikipedia:WikiProject Women in Red") 2024 Events**:

This section is [transcluded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Transclusion> "Help:Transclusion") from [Wikipedia:Tech news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tech_news> "Wikipedia:Tech news"). ([edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Tech_news&action=edit>) | [history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Tech_news&action=history>))
Latest **[tech news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News")** from the Wikimedia technical community. Please tell other users about these changes. Not all changes will affect you. [Translations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/13> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/13") are available. 
**Weekly highlight**
  * The Wikimedia Foundation is seeking your feedback on the [drafts of the objectives and key results that will shape the Foundation's Product and Technology priorities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Wikimedia_Foundation_Annual_Plan/2025-2026/Product_%26_Technology_OKRs> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Wikimedia Foundation Annual Plan/2025-2026/Product & Technology OKRs") for the next fiscal year (starting in July). The objectives are broad high-level areas, and the key-results are measurable ways to track the success of their objectives. Please share your feedback on the talkpage, in any language, ideally before the end of April.


**Updates for editors**
  * The [CampaignEvents extension](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:CampaignEvents> "mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:CampaignEvents") will be released to multiple wikis (see [deployment plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Deployment_status#Global_Deployment_Plan> "m:Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Deployment status") for details) in April 2025, and the team has begun the process of engaging communities on the identified wikis. The extension provides tools to organize, manage, and promote collaborative activities (like events, edit-a-thons, and WikiProjects) on the wikis. The extension has three tools: [Event Registration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Event_Center/Registration> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Event Center/Registration"), [Collaboration List](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Collaboration_list> "m:Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Collaboration list"), and [Invitation Lists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Campaigns/Foundation_Product_Team/Invitation_list> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Campaigns/Foundation Product Team/Invitation list"). It is currently on 13 Wikipedias, including English Wikipedia, French Wikipedia, and Spanish Wikipedia, as well as Wikidata. Questions or requests can be directed to the [extension talk page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help_talk:Extension:CampaignEvents> "mw:Help talk:Extension:CampaignEvents") or in Phabricator (with #campaigns-product-team tag).
  * Starting the week of March 31st, wikis will be able to set which user groups can view private registrants in [Event Registration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Event_Center/Registration> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Event Center/Registration"), as part of the [CampaignEvents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:CampaignEvents> "mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:CampaignEvents") extension. By default, event organizers and the local wiki admins will be able to see private registrants. This is a change from the current behavior, in which only event organizers can see private registrants. Wikis can change the default setup by [requesting a configuration change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Requesting_wiki_configuration_changes> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Requesting wiki configuration changes") in Phabricator (and adding the #campaigns-product-team tag). Participants of past events can cancel their registration at any time.
  * Administrators at wikis that have a customized [MediaWiki:Sidebar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/MediaWiki:Sidebar> "MediaWiki:Sidebar") should check that it contains an entry for the Special pages listing. If it does not, they should add it using `* specialpages-url|specialpages`. Wikis with a default sidebar will see the link moved from the page toolbox into the sidebar menu in April. [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/phabricator.wikimedia.org/T388927>)
  * The Minerva skin (mobile web) combines both Notice and Alert notifications within the bell icon (![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/OOjs_UI_icon_bell.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_bell.svg.png)). There was a long-standing bug where an indication for new notifications was only shown if you had unseen Alerts. This bug is now fixed. In the future, Minerva users will notice a counter atop the bell icon when you have 1 or more unseen Notices and/or Alerts. [[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/phabricator.wikimedia.org/T344029>)
  * ![Recurrent item](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/20px-Octicons-sync.svg.png) View all 23 community-submitted tasks that were [resolved last week](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Recently_resolved_community_tasks> "m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Recently resolved community tasks").


**Updates for technical contributors**
  * VisualEditor has introduced a [new client-side hook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/VisualEditor/Hooks> "mw:VisualEditor/Hooks") for developers to use when integrating with the VisualEditor target lifecycle. This hook should replace the existing lifecycle-related hooks, and be more consistent between different platforms. In addition, the new hook will apply to uses of VisualEditor outside of just full article editing, allowing gadgets to interact with the editor in DiscussionTools as well. The Editing Team intends to deprecate and eventually remove the old lifecycle hooks, so any use cases that this new hook does not cover would be of interest to them and can be [shared in the task](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/phabricator.wikimedia.org/T355555> "phab:T355555").
  * Developers who use the `mw.Api` JavaScript library, can now identify the tool using it with the `userAgent` parameter: `var api = new mw.Api( { userAgent: 'GadgetNameHere/1.0.1' } );`. If you maintain a gadget or user script, please set a user agent, because it helps with library and server maintenance and with differentiating between legitimate and illegitimate traffic. [[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/phabricator.wikimedia.org/T373874>)[[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/foundation.wikimedia.org/wiki/Policy:Wikimedia_Foundation_User-Agent_Policy>)
  * ![Recurrent item](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/20px-Octicons-sync.svg.png) Detailed code updates later this week: [MediaWiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki_1.44/wmf.22> "mw:MediaWiki 1.44/wmf.22")

##  Tip of the day 
[Tip of the day...](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day> "Wikipedia:Tip of the day")
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png/120px-Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png)
**Working on the Main Page - I**
Being the gateway to the encyclopedia - the [Main Page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Main_Page> "Main Page") is Wikipedia's most frequently visited page. The main page is always [protected](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy> "Wikipedia:Protection policy") and can only be edited by [admins](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Administrators> "Wikipedia:Administrators"). _But_ , most of the content on the main page is piped in each day from various departments, via [templates](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Template_namespace> "Wikipedia:Template namespace"). The volunteers in these departments work year round to prepare the content on the Main Page to be viewed by the World each day. 
The departments that prep content for the Main Page are: 
  * **[Wikipedia:Today's featured article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Today%27s_featured_article> "Wikipedia:Today's featured article")** – prepares excerpts from featured articles, to be displayed on the main page.
  * **[Wikipedia:Did you know](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Did_you_know> "Wikipedia:Did you know")** – prepares and selects "hooks" to new articles or articles that have been expanded by a factor of five.
  * **[Wikipedia:In the news](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:In_the_news> "Wikipedia:In the news")** – participants nominate blurbs from [Portal:Current events](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Portal:Current_events> "Portal:Current events"), and decide which of these get displayed on the main page. Admins post the blurbs as soon as they are approved.
  * **[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Selected_anniversaries> "Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries")** – prepares the pages that get displayed in the "On this day" section of the main page.
  * **[Wikipedia:Picture of the day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Picture_of_the_day> "Wikipedia:Picture of the day")** – copies and formats featured pictures into the POTD scheduling queue, and writes the captions that accompany the pictures.


Anybody can help prep the pages that feed into the main page's templates (up until the day they are displayed on the Main Page), by proofreading and correcting them, and we encourage you to do so. _(continued tomorrow)_
[Prior tip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day/March_28> "Wikipedia:Tip of the day/March 28") – [Tips library](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tips> "Wikipedia:Tips") – [Next tip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day/March_30> "Wikipedia:Tip of the day/March 30")

About contribution quality predictionsThese predictions are made by a machine-learning service trained on a large set of edits scored by human editors. Stricter, more accurate filters find fewer false positives but miss more of their target. Less accurate filters find more of their target, but they also find more false positives.[Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:New_filters_for_edit_review/Quality_and_Intent_Filters>)
About user intent predictionsThese predictions about users' good faith are made by a machine-learning service trained on a large set of edits scored by human editors. Stricter, more accurate filters find fewer false positives but miss more of their target. Less accurate filters find more of their target, but they also find more false positives.[Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:New_filters_for_edit_review/Quality_and_Intent_Filters>)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Wikimedia file upload wizard
[Shortcut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Shortcut> "Wikipedia:Shortcut")
  * [WP:FUW](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:FUW&redirect=no>)


Thank you for offering to contribute an image or other media file for use on Wikipedia. This wizard will guide you through a questionnaire prompting you for the appropriate copyright and sourcing information for each file. Please ensure you understand [copyright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Copyrights> "Wikipedia:Copyrights") and the [image use policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Image_use_policy> "Wikipedia:Image use policy") before proceeding. 
[Upload your own or a freely licensed file](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:UploadWizard> "commons:Special:UploadWizard")
Uploads to [Wikimedia Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Wikimedia_Commons> "Wikipedia:Wikimedia Commons")
[Upload a non-free file](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:File_upload_wizard&withJS=MediaWiki:FileUploadWizard.js&withCSS=MediaWiki:FileUploadWizard.css>)
Uploads locally to the English Wikipedia; must comply with the [non-free content](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Non-free_content> "Wikipedia:Non-free content") criteria 
**You do not have JavaScript enabled**
Sorry, in order to use this uploading script, JavaScript must be enabled. You can still use the plain [Special:Upload](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:Upload> "Special:Upload") page to upload files to the English Wikipedia without JavaScript. 
**You are not currently logged in.**
Sorry, in order to use this uploading script and to upload files, you need to be logged in with your named account. Please **[log in](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:UserLogin&returnto=Wikipedia%3AFile+Upload+Wizard&returntoquery=withJS%3DMediaWiki%253AFileUploadWizard.js>)** and then try again. 
**Your account has not become confirmed yet.**
Sorry, in order to upload files on the English Wikipedia, you need to have a [confirmed account](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:AUTOCONFIRM> "Wikipedia:AUTOCONFIRM"). Normally, your account will become confirmed automatically once you have made 10 edits and four days have passed since you created it. 
You may already be able to upload files on the [Wikimedia Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/> "commons:"), but you can't do it on the English Wikipedia just yet. If the file you want to upload has a free license, please go to Commons and upload it there. 
**Important note:** if you don't want to wait until you are autoconfirmed, you may ask somebody else to upload a file for you at [Wikipedia:Files for upload](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Files_for_upload> "Wikipedia:Files for upload"). 
In very rare cases an administrator may make your account confirmed manually through a request at [Wikipedia:Requests for permissions/Confirmed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Requests_for_permissions/Confirmed> "Wikipedia:Requests for permissions/Confirmed").
## Step 1: Choose your file
File: | Choose a file from your computer. Maximum file size: 100 MB.Permitted file types: png, gif, jpg, jpeg, xcf, pdf, mid, mp3, mpeg, mpg, ogg, ogv, opus, svg, djvu, tiff, tif, oga, flac, wav, wave, webm, webp.  
---|---  
## Step 2: Describe your file
Please provide a clear, descriptive name by which your file will be known on Wikipedia.   
---  
This name must be unique across the whole of Wikipedia, so please make it informative and easy to recognize.It's no problem to use a fairly long name. It may also include spaces, commas and most other punctuation marks.Please also note that file names are case sensitive (with the exception of the first letter).**Good:** "City of London, skyline from London City Hall, Oct 2008.jpg". **Bad** : "Skyline.jpg", "DSC0001234.jpg".  
Sorry, a few special characters and character combinations cannot be used in the filename for technical reasons. This goes especially for **# < > [ ] | : { } / ** and **~~~**. Your filename has been modified to avoid these. Please check if it is okay now. 
The filename you chose seems to be very short, or overly generic. Please don't use: 
  * Titles that consist only of very generic descriptive words (e.g. "Sunset.jpg", "Townhall.jpg")
  * Titles that consist only of a person's first or last name, when that name is likely to be shared by many others (e.g. "John.jpg", "Miller.jpg")
  * Titles that consist of mere numbers, of the kind often produced by digital cameras ("DSC_001234", "IMGP0345"), or random strings like those sometimes found on the web ("30996951316264l.jpg")


[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a9/Example.jpg/250px-Example.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Example.jpg>)[Existing file](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Example.jpg> "File:Example.jpg").Last uploaded by Example user.
**A file of this name already exists on Commons!**
If you upload your file with this name, you will be masking the existing file and make it inaccessible. Your new file will be displayed everywhere the existing file was previously used. 
This should not be done, except in very rare exceptional cases. 
Please don't upload your file under this name, unless you seriously know what you are doing. Choose a different name for your new file instead. 
If you want to replace the existing file with an uncontroversial, improved version of the same work, please go to Commons and upload it there, not here on the English Wikipedia's local wiki. 
**A file of this name already exists.**
If you upload your file with this name, you will be overwriting the existing file. Your new file will be displayed everywhere the existing file was previously used. Please don't do this, unless you have a good reason to: 
**No** , I don't want to overwrite the existing file. I will choose a different name for my new file instead.   
---  
**Yes** , I want to overwrite the existing file. My file is merely a new, improved and uncontentious version of the same work. The old description page, including the source and copyright information, will still be correct for the new version and can remain the same.   
**Yes** , I want to overwrite the existing file, and I will use this wizard to add a new description and new source information for it. The previous version was my own, or else I have made sure the previous uploader(s) don't object to this replacement.   
Please provide a brief description of the contents of this file.This will be stored and displayed as part of the file description page. It is important that other editors are able to understand what this file is about.  
---  
What does this file show? What is it a photo/diagram/recording of?It will be helpful if you also add a [wikilink](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Cheatsheet#Internal_link> "Wikipedia:Cheatsheet") to the article where you want to use it.  
## Step 3: Provide source and copyright information
It is very important that you read through the following options and questions, and provide all required information truthfully and carefully.
**This is a free work.** I can demonstrate that it is legally okay for anybody to use, in Wikipedia and elsewhere, for any purpose.  **Thank you for offering to upload a free work.** Wikipedia loves free files. However, we would love it even more if you uploaded them on our sister project, the [Wikimedia Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/> "commons:"). Files uploaded on Commons can be used immediately here on Wikipedia as well as on all its sister projects. Uploading files on Commons works just the same as here. Your Wikipedia account will automatically work on Commons too. ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Gtk-dialog-info.svg/30px-Gtk-dialog-info.svg.png) **Please consider[uploading your file on Commons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:UploadWizard> "commons:Special:UploadWizard").** However, if you prefer to do it here instead, you may go ahead with this form. You can also first use this form to collect the information about your file and then send it to Commons from here.  | Copyright status:

This file is **entirely my own work.** I am the copyright holder. I made this myself, from scratch, without copying or incorporating anybody else's creative work, and I am willing to release it under a free license. Please note that by "entirely self-made" we really mean just that. **Do not** use this section for any of the following: 
  * a scan or photograph you made of a painting, drawing, printed page or other item originally created by somebody else. The copyright belongs to the original creator, not to you.
  * a screenshot or other kind of capture of a video, computer screen, TV programme or other kind of visual media.
  * a picture you created by modifying or copying some other picture or by combining several preexisting pictures made by somebody else.
  * a picture given to you by somebody else.
  * a picture you found somewhere on the Internet.

Editors who falsely declare such items as their "own work" **will be blocked from editing**.  | Please describe how and when you created this item.

Public Domainstatus: | This work is free of all copyrights because:  | It was created by an agency of the US Federal Government.This does **not** apply to [most US state and local agencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Copyright_status_of_work_by_U.S._subnational_governments> "Copyright status of work by U.S. subnational governments"), nor to governments of other countries!  
---  
It is an official governmental item, such as a flag, state emblem, banknote or postage stamp, from a country where such items are exempt from copyright according to local law.This does **not** apply to all countries, nor does it usually apply to **all** publications! (For instance, it usually doesn't apply to simple publicity photographs published on a governmental website.) Please look up the copyright rules for the specific country in question. If the country does not have an exemption rule that applies to this item, go on with the section for "[non-free copyrighted works](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/<#Non-free_section>)" below.Explanation: Add any explanation or evidence necessary to substantiate your statement above. Cite and provide a link to the relevant law if possible.  
It is too simple to be eligible for copyright.This typically applies only to graphics that consist solely of simple geometric shapes and/or a few letters or words, or to items such as mathematical or chemical formulae. It may apply to some very simple logos that do not contain complex pictorial elements. It **never** applies to photographs!  
It is in the Public Domain for some other reason.Explanation:  
**This is a copyrighted, non-free work, but I believe it is Fair Use.** I have read the Wikipedia rules on **[Non-Free Content](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NFC> "Wikipedia:NFC")** , and I am prepared to explain how the use of this file will meet the criteria set out there.  ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Gtk-dialog-info.svg/15px-Gtk-dialog-info.svg.png) Please remember that you will need to demonstrate that: 
  * The file will serve an important function in a particular article; ([NFCC8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NFCC#8> "Wikipedia:NFCC"))
  * It cannot be replaced by any other, free illustration that might yet be created; ([NFCC1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NFCC#1> "Wikipedia:NFCC"))
  * Its use does not negatively affect the commercial interests of its owner ([NFCC2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NFCC#2> "Wikipedia:NFCC"))
  * There will not be more non-free material used than necessary. ([NFCC3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:NFCC#3> "Wikipedia:NFCC"))

This file will be used in the following article: Enter the name of exactly one Wikipedia article, without the [[...]] brackets and without the "http://en.wikipedia.org/..." URL code. It has to be an actual article, not a talkpage, template, user page, etc. If you plan to use the file in more than one article, please name only one of them here. Then, after uploading, open the image description page for editing and add your separate explanations for each additional article manually. ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b7/Gtk-ok.svg/20px-Gtk-ok.svg.png) **[Example](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Example> "Example")** – article okay.  ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Gtk-dialog-warning.svg/20px-Gtk-dialog-warning.svg.png) **This article doesn't exist!** The article [Example](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Example> "Example") could not be found. Please check the spelling, and make sure you enter the name of an existing article in which you will include this file. If this is an article you are only planning to write, please write it first and upload the file afterwards.  ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Gtk-dialog-warning.svg/20px-Gtk-dialog-warning.svg.png) **This is not an actual encyclopedia article!** The page [Example](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Example> "Example") is not in the main article namespace. Non-free files can only be used in mainspace article pages, not on a user page, talk page, template, etc. Please upload this file only if it is going to be used in an actual article.  If this page is an article draft in your user space, we're sorry, but we must ask you to wait until the page is ready and has been moved into mainspace, and only upload the file after that.  ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Gtk-dialog-warning.svg/20px-Gtk-dialog-warning.svg.png) **This is a disambiguation page!** The page [Example](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Example> "Example") is not a real article, but a disambiguation page pointing to a number of other pages. Please check and enter the exact title of the actual target article you meant.  | Non-free use rationale

Well, we're very sorry, but if you're not sure about this file's copyright status, or if it doesn't fit into any of the groups above, then: **Please don't upload it.** Really, please don't. Even if you think it would make for a great addition to an article. We really take these copyright rules very seriously on Wikipedia. Note that media is _assumed_ to be fully-copyrighted unless shown otherwise; the burden is on the uploader. In particular, please don't upload: 
  * any file you simply found on some website, without knowing who its author or copyright owner is.
  * any file you found somewhere, even if you have good reason to believe it has a copyright owner who would not mind us using it, but you don't have an explicit licensing statement from them.
  * any file that was released for publicity purposes by its owners but doesn't have a fully-free license for free re-use for all purposes.
  * any file credited to a commercial image agency, such as Reuters, AP or Getty Images. Such files normally cannot be used even under the "Fair Use" rules, except in rare cases.
  * any file that is licensed for use exclusively on Wikipedia, or is free except that the free license excludes commercial use.

If you are in any doubt, please ask some experienced editors for advice before uploading. People will be happy to assist you at [Wikipedia:Media copyright questions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Media_copyright_questions> "Wikipedia:Media copyright questions"). Thank you.

## Upload in process
Your file is being uploaded. 
This might take a minute or two, depending on the size of the file and the speed of your internet connection. 
Once uploading is completed, you will find your new file at this link: 
**[File:Example.jpg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Example.jpg> "File:Example.jpg")**
## File successfully uploaded
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/a/a9/Example.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Example.jpg>)
Your file has been uploaded successfully and can now be found here: 
**[File:Example.jpg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/File:Example.jpg> "File:Example.jpg")**
Please follow the link and check that the image description page has all the information you meant to include. 
If you want to change the description, just go to the image page, click the "edit" tab at the top of the page and edit just as you would edit any other page. Do not go through this upload form again, unless you want to replace the actual file with a new version. 
To insert this file into an article, you may want to use code similar to the following: 
```
[[File:Example.jpg|thumb|right|insert a caption here]]

```

If you wish to make a link to the file in text, without actually showing the image, for instance when discussing the image on a talk page, you can use the following (mark the ":" after the initial brackets!): 
```
[[:File:Example.jpg]]

```

See [Wikipedia:Picture tutorial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:Picture_tutorial> "Wikipedia:Picture tutorial") for more detailed help on how to insert and position images in pages. 
**Thank you for using the File Upload Wizard.** Please leave your feedback, comments, bug reports or suggestions on the [talk page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia_talk:File_upload_wizard> "Wikipedia talk:File upload wizard").

In other projects 
This page contains a list of [special pages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:Special_page> "Help:Special page"). Most of the content of these pages is automatically generated and cannot be edited. To suggest a change to the parts that _can_ be edited, find the appropriate text on [Special:AllMessages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Special:AllMessages> "Special:AllMessages") and then request your change on the talk page of the message (using {{[editprotected](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Template:Edit_fully-protected> "Template:Edit fully-protected")}} to draw the attention of administrators). 
You can also see what message names are used on a page by adding `?uselang=qqx` to the end of its URL, e.g. <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:SpecialPages?uselang=qqx> will show `(specialpages-summary)` in place of this message, which allows you to find [MediaWiki:Specialpages-summary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/MediaWiki:Specialpages-summary> "MediaWiki:Specialpages-summary"). 
For an index of special pages, see [Help:SpecialPages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Help:SpecialPages#Alphabetical_order> "Help:SpecialPages").

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
# Welcome to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia> "Wikipedia")
,
the [free](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Free_content> "Free content") [encyclopedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Encyclopedia> "Encyclopedia") that [anyone can edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Help:Introduction_to_Wikipedia> "Help:Introduction to Wikipedia").
  * [125,074](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Special:Statistics> "Special:Statistics") active editors
  * [6,974,023](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Special:Statistics> "Special:Statistics") articles in [English](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/English_language> "English language")


## From today's featured article
[![Hurricane Cindy on July 5](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg/122px-Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/File:Hurricane_Cindy_2005-07-05.jpg> "Hurricane Cindy on July 5")
**[Hurricane Cindy](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Hurricane_Cindy_\(2005\)> "Hurricane Cindy \(2005\)")** was a [tropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Tropical_cyclone> "Tropical cyclone") that made [landfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Landfall> "Landfall") in the U.S. state of [Louisiana](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Louisiana> "Louisiana") in July 2005. The third named storm of the [2005 Atlantic hurricane season](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/2005_Atlantic_hurricane_season> "2005 Atlantic hurricane season"), Cindy developed from a [tropical wave](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Tropical_wave> "Tropical wave") on July 3, off the east coast of Mexico's [Yucatán Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Yucat%C3%A1n_Peninsula> "Yucatán Peninsula"). Soon after, it moved over land before emerging into the [Gulf of Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Gulf_of_Mexico> "Gulf of Mexico"). It tracked toward the northern [Gulf Coast](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Gulf_Coast_of_the_United_States> "Gulf Coast of the United States") and strengthened to reach [maximum sustained winds](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Maximum_sustained_wind> "Maximum sustained wind") of 75 mph (120 km/h), making it a Category 1 on the [Saffir–Simpson scale](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Saffir%E2%80%93Simpson_scale> "Saffir–Simpson scale"). The hurricane struck Louisiana, on July 5 at peak intensity, but weakened by the time it made a second landfall along southern [Mississippi](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Mississippi> "Mississippi"). It weakened over the southeastern US and transitioned into an [extratropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Extratropical_cyclone> "Extratropical cyclone") on July 7. The remnants of Cindy produced an outbreak of 42 tornadoes across six states before they moved into Atlantic Canada and dissipated on July 13 over the [Gulf of St. Lawrence](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Gulf_of_St._Lawrence> "Gulf of St. Lawrence"). Cindy caused six traffic deaths and its damage was significant. (**[Full article...](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Hurricane_Cindy_\(2005\)> "Hurricane Cindy \(2005\)")**)

## Did you know ...
[![De Lamar Mansion](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/66/Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg/250px-Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/File:Polish_consulate_in_New_York.jpg> "De Lamar Mansion")
De Lamar Mansion
  * ... that the exterior of the **[De Lamar Mansion](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Joseph_Raphael_De_Lamar_House> "Joseph Raphael De Lamar House")** _(pictured)_ was cleaned using toothbrushes during the 2000s?
  * ... that **[Edward Skeletrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Edward_Skeletrix> "Edward Skeletrix")** , to promote his album _**[Museum Music](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Museum_Music> "Museum Music")**_ , held an exhibition during which he sat inside a glass box?
  * ... that the fortified walls surrounding the Iron Age **[Tell Ruqeish](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Tell_Ruqeish> "Tell Ruqeish")** in Palestine are up to 5.5 metres (18 feet) thick?
  * ... that the **[Raymond C. and Mildred Kramer House](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Raymond_C._and_Mildred_Kramer_House> "Raymond C. and Mildred Kramer House")** was one of fewer than half a dozen houses built in Manhattan during 1934?
  * ... that the sustainability of the **[Baggu](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Baggu> "Baggu")** reusable bag is challenged by collector culture?
  * ... that NFL player **[Obe Wenig](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Obe_Wenig> "Obe Wenig")** was named an [All-Pro](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/All-Pro> "All-Pro") even though he played only one game?
  * ... that director [Isao Takahata](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Isao_Takahata> "Isao Takahata") reportedly stayed overnight at a [doss-house](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Flophouse> "Flophouse") to ensure that the Japanese animated film _**[Jarinko Chie](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Jarinko_Chie_\(film\)> "Jarinko Chie \(film\)")**_ accurately depicts the city of [Osaka](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Osaka> "Osaka")?
  * ... that the least populous of **[Oregon's cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/List_of_cities_in_Oregon> "List of cities in Oregon")** has three people?
  * ... that journalist **[Ivan Miller](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Ivan_Miller_\(journalist\)> "Ivan Miller \(journalist\)")** was once bitten by a disgruntled Santa Claus?


  * **[Archive](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Recent_additions> "Wikipedia:Recent additions")**

## In the news
[![Riek Machar](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Riek_Machar_VOA_photo_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Riek_Machar_VOA_photo_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/File:Riek_Machar_VOA_photo_\(cropped\).jpg> "Riek Machar")
Riek Machar
  * **[A magnitude-7.7 earthquake](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/2025_Myanmar_earthquake> "2025 Myanmar earthquake")** leaves more than 1,000 people dead in Myanmar and Thailand.
  * The [Sudan People's Liberation Movement-in-Opposition](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Sudan_People%27s_Liberation_Movement-in-Opposition> "Sudan People's Liberation Movement-in-Opposition") unilaterally voids the [2018 peace agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/South_Sudanese_Civil_War#2018_peace_agreement_\(2018–2020\)> "South Sudanese Civil War") after South Sudanese vice president [Riek Machar](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Riek_Machar> "Riek Machar") _(pictured)_ and interior minister [Angelina Teny](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Angelina_Teny> "Angelina Teny") **[are detained](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Riek_Machar#2025_arrest> "Riek Machar")**.
  * The [Sudanese Armed Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Sudanese_Armed_Forces> "Sudanese Armed Forces") **[recapture Khartoum](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Battle_of_Khartoum_\(2023%E2%80%932025\)> "Battle of Khartoum \(2023–2025\)")** from the [Rapid Support Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Rapid_Support_Forces> "Rapid Support Forces") after almost two years of fighting.

## On this day
**[March 29](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/March_29> "March 29")** : **[Boganda Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Barth%C3%A9lemy_Boganda> "Barthélemy Boganda")** in the Central African Republic ([1959](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/1959> "1959")); **[Martyrs' Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Malagasy_Uprising> "Malagasy Uprising")** in Madagascar ([1947](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/1947> "1947")) 
[![Mariner 10](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/60/Mariner10.gif/250px-Mariner10.gif)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/File:Mariner10.gif> "Mariner 10")
_Mariner 10_
  * [1461](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/1461> "1461") – [Wars of the Roses](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wars_of_the_Roses> "Wars of the Roses"): The [Yorkists](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/House_of_York> "House of York") defeated the [Lancastrian army](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/House_of_Lancaster> "House of Lancaster") at the **[Battle of Towton](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Battle_of_Towton> "Battle of Towton")** , allowing [Edward IV](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Edward_IV> "Edward IV") to secure the English throne.
  * [1882](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/1882> "1882") – The **[Knights of Columbus](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Knights_of_Columbus> "Knights of Columbus")** , the world's largest Catholic fraternal [service organization](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Service_club> "Service club"), was founded by [Michael J. McGivney](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Michael_J._McGivney> "Michael J. McGivney") in [New Haven, Connecticut](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/New_Haven,_Connecticut> "New Haven, Connecticut"), U.S.
  * [1974](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/1974> "1974") – [NASA](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/NASA> "NASA")'s _**[Mariner 10](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Mariner_10> "Mariner 10")**_ _(pictured)_ became the first [space probe](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Uncrewed_spacecraft> "Uncrewed spacecraft") to make a [flyby](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Planetary_flyby> "Planetary flyby") of [Mercury](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Mercury_\(planet\)> "Mercury \(planet\)").
  * [2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/2014> "2014") – The first **[same-sex marriages in England and Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_the_United_Kingdom> "Same-sex marriage in the United Kingdom")** took place following the passage of the [Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Marriage_\(Same_Sex_Couples\)_Act_2013> "Marriage \(Same Sex Couples\) Act 2013").


  * **[Thomas Coram](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Thomas_Coram> "Thomas Coram")** (d. 1751)

## Today's featured picture
[![Silene flos-cuculi](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg/500px-Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/File:Silene_flos-cuculi_flower_-_Niitv%C3%A4lja.jpg> "Silene flos-cuculi") |  _**[Silene flos-cuculi](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Silene_flos-cuculi> "Silene flos-cuculi")**_ , commonly known as the ragged robin, is a perennial herbaceous plant in the family [Caryophyllaceae](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Caryophyllaceae> "Caryophyllaceae"). Native to Europe and Asia, it is found along roads and in [wet meadows](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wet_meadow> "Wet meadow") and pastures, and has also become naturalized in parts of North America. It forms a rosette of low growing foliage with numerous stems that are 30 to 90 centimetres (12 to 36 inches) tall. The stems rise above the foliage and branch near the top of the stem, the stems having barbed hairs which point downward and make the plant rough to the touch. The middle and upper leaves are linear-lanceolate with pointed apexes. Butterflies and long-tongued bees feed on the flowers' nectar. In addition to these pollinators, the flowers are visited by many other types of insects, and can be characterized by a generalized [pollination syndrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Pollination_syndrome> "Pollination syndrome"). This _S. flos-cuculi_ flower was photographed in [Niitvälja](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Niitv%C3%A4lja> "Niitvälja"), Estonia. This picture was [focus-stacked](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Focus_stacking> "Focus stacking") from 27 separate images.  Photograph credit: [Ivar Leidus](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/<https:/commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Iifar> "c:User:Iifar") Recently featured: 
  * [Joseph Bazalgette](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Template:POTD/2025-03-28> "Template:POTD/2025-03-28")
  * [Mauritius ornate day gecko](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Template:POTD/2025-03-27> "Template:POTD/2025-03-27")
  * [Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Template:POTD/2025-03-26> "Template:POTD/2025-03-26")

## Other areas of Wikipedia
  * **[Community portal](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Community_portal> "Wikipedia:Community portal")** – The central hub for editors, with resources, links, tasks, and announcements.
  * **[Village pump](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Village_pump> "Wikipedia:Village pump")** – Forum for discussions about Wikipedia itself, including policies and technical issues.
  * **[Site news](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:News> "Wikipedia:News")** – Sources of news about Wikipedia and the broader Wikimedia movement.
  * **[Teahouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Teahouse> "Wikipedia:Teahouse")** – Ask basic questions about using or editing Wikipedia.
  * **[Help desk](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Help_desk> "Wikipedia:Help desk")** – Ask questions about using or editing Wikipedia.
  * **[Reference desk](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Reference_desk> "Wikipedia:Reference desk")** – Ask research questions about encyclopedic topics.
  * **[Content portals](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/</wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Portals> "Wikipedia:Contents/Portals")** – A unique way to navigate the encyclopedia.

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
### Welcome to this talk page
People on Wikipedia can use this [talk page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/</wiki/Wikipedia:User_pages> "Wikipedia:User pages") to post a public message about edits made from the IP address you are currently using. 
Many IP addresses change periodically, and are often shared by several people. About contribution quality predictionsThese predictions are made by a machine-learning service trained on a large set of edits scored by human editors. Stricter, more accurate filters find fewer false positives but miss more of their target. Less accurate filters find more of their target, but they also find more false positives.[Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChangesLinked/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:New_filters_for_edit_review/Quality_and_Intent_Filters>)
About user intent predictionsThese predictions about users' good faith are made by a machine-learning service trained on a large set of edits scored by human editors. Stricter, more accurate filters find fewer false positives but miss more of their target. Less accurate filters find more of their target, but they also find more false positives.[Learn more](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChangesLinked/<https:/www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:New_filters_for_edit_review/Quality_and_Intent_Filters>)
